story:
BACKGROUND

Offend-Me-Not! had its first staged reading in New York City at the Magnet Theater Training Center in March of 2017. The show generated a lot of laughs and was followed by such an animated talkback with audience members that I realized the material was not only funny, but socially significant as well. To my surprise, I’d ironically created a “safe space” for audience members from a wide range of racial backgrounds and sexual orientations to share their anxiety about potential ostracism for having opinions that don’t precisely conform to PC orthodoxy. 

One audience member asked if I embraced Donald Trump’s version of political incorrectness. This question was not unexpected. In today’s polarized environment, stating that you don’t completely agree with the tenets of political correctness can land you in the Trump camp. I replied emphatically that I do not. What I do champion is a forum for listening to many points of view on the ideological spectrum. The after show discussion offered that opportunity.

  

As the audience members talked about their experiences, there was a palpable sense of relief in the room. “When will you be staging this next?” they asked. “How can we keep talking?” They longed to continue the dialogue, and I became determined to make that happen.

This is where I need your help. Enter Indigogo!

WHAT'S NEXT & WHERE YOU COME IN

The next step in Offend-Me-Not!'s development is a full production for New York audiences. The footwork I did for the staged reading gave me knowledge of the NYC live entertainment industry, from casting the show and booking venues to getting the word out and staging the production. I will capitalize on this experience to produce the highest quality show possible so that it can continue to educate as it entertains. I will also be hiring a professional videographer to tape this production to have submission material for other performance opportunities in the region and across the US. 

The production will require further casting, rehearsal space, venue rental, props, advertising, promotional materials, and my travel to NYC. All of this takes money. That's where you come in. Your donation will be used to pay artists, rental fees, promotional costs, travel expenses, and ideally we'd love a pot of coffee on set every so often. 

Casting will begin in January, with rehearsals starting in February for a March production. The rehearsal schedule will include a minimum of seven full cast meetings. Advertising, listing notices, promotion, and publicity for the show will begin as soon as casting is set. The run itself will consist of two shows, both to be videotaped for future use. 

WHO AM I

I’m Elizabeth Appleby, a writer, director, and performer with extensive experience in helping people express themselves. I ran a small theater in Cambridge, MA where I directed over 20 productions, several of which won  Best Director awards.  I’ve run groups in hospitals as well as having taught acting at Emerson College in Boston. My comedic stories have been featured on Public Radio International and my solo show, Fritz Perls is my (tor) Mentor, was the winner of the Competition for New Works at San Francisco’s Marsh Theater and the recipient of a grant from the Zellerbach Family Foundation.

Currently I teach presentation skills to international postdoctoral researchers from Harvard Medical School. Yes, Harvard is in Boston. That’s where I live. It’s also where  the Puritans  lived. The show is starting in NYC, can you blame me?

THANK YOU!!

Asking for money isn’t something that I’m used to doing. It’s therefore with tremendous humility and gratitude that I'm reaching out for your support. Offend-Me-Not! is a project I truly believe in. With public discourse becoming more contentious by the day, this show couldn’t be more timely. It offers a springboard for honest conversation on a topic that’s become increasingly challenging. 

And not only will you be helping to stem the tide of vitriolic communication in America, but you'll receive some one-of-a-kind, Offense-free perks!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Spread the word of our campaign to your friends and neighbors!

Share this page widely on social media - you never know who will be inspired to contribute!

Come to the show in NYC!

One audience member asked if I embraced Donald Trump’s version of political incorrectness. This question was not unexpected. In today’s polarized environment, stating that you don’t completely agree with the tenets of political correctness can land you in the Trump camp. I replied emphatically that I do not. What I do champion is a forum for listening to many points of view on the ideological spectrum. The after show discussion offered that opportunity.
  
As the audience members talked about their experiences, there was a palpable sense of relief in the room. “When will you be staging this next?” they asked. “How can we keep talking?” They longed to continue the dialogue, and I became determined to make that happen.
This is where I need your help. Enter Indigogo!
WHAT'S NEXT & WHERE YOU COME IN
The next step in Offend-Me-Not!'s development is a full production for New York audiences. The footwork I did for the staged reading gave me knowledge of the NYC live entertainment industry, from casting the show and booking venues to getting the word out and staging the production. I will capitalize on this experience to produce the highest quality show possible so that it can continue to educate as it entertains. I will also be hiring a professional videographer to tape this production to have submission material for other performance opportunities in the region and across the US. 
The production will require further casting, rehearsal space, venue rental, props, advertising, promotional materials, and my travel to NYC. All of this takes money. That's where you come in. Your donation will be used to pay artists, rental fees, promotional costs, travel expenses, and ideally we'd love a pot of coffee on set every so often. 

Casting will begin in January, with rehearsals starting in February for a March production. The rehearsal schedule will include a minimum of seven full cast meetings. Advertising, listing notices, promotion, and publicity for the show will begin as soon as casting is set. The run itself will consist of two shows, both to be videotaped for future use. 
WHO AM I
I’m Elizabeth Appleby, a writer, director, and performer with extensive experience in helping people express themselves. I ran a small theater in Cambridge, MA where I directed over 20 productions, several of which won  Best Director awards.  I’ve run groups in hospitals as well as having taught acting at Emerson College in Boston. My comedic stories have been featured on Public Radio International and my solo show, Fritz Perls is my (tor) Mentor, was the winner of the Competition for New Works at San Francisco’s Marsh Theater and the recipient of a grant from the Zellerbach Family Foundation.
Currently I teach presentation skills to international postdoctoral researchers from Harvard Medical School. Yes, Harvard is in Boston. That’s where I live. It’s also where  the Puritans  lived. The show is starting in NYC, can you blame me?
THANK YOU!!
Asking for money isn’t something that I’m used to doing. It’s therefore with tremendous humility and gratitude that I'm reaching out for your support. Offend-Me-Not! is a project I truly believe in. With public discourse becoming more contentious by the day, this show couldn’t be more timely. It offers a springboard for honest conversation on a topic that’s become increasingly challenging. 
And not only will you be helping to stem the tide of vitriolic communication in America, but you'll receive some one-of-a-kind, Offense-free perks!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Spread the word of our campaign to your friends and neighbors!
Share this page widely on social media - you never know who will be inspired to contribute!
Come to the show in NYC!

story:
Zach Bivins and Ian Stevens of Amphora Media in Seattle have been selected to film Ling Hui's 2019 dance performance Move the Smky.  

An example of Zach and Ian's work can be seen here:

https://www.washington.edu/news/2016/03/04/uw-v...

Our goal is to raise $635.  This covers the cost of filming and producing the video of this performance and keeping it available on Vimeo. 

If we reach our goal, we will have a video of the performance for ourselves, our kids and those who could not attend the performance.  This video will be available for viewing and downloading. (The video will be password protected for privacy but the password will be given to parents of the dancers.)

story:
About X RATED PLANET

Embodiment Project is a street dance theater company founded in 2008 by choreographer Nicole Klaymoon.  Our mission is to illuminate narratives silenced by inequities to inspire critical conversation and healing. KQED wrote, “ Arts and life collide in Nicole Klaymoon’s works of dance and documentary theater... with a wit that is sometimes poignant, sometimes lacerating, Klaymoon avoids polemic in pursuit of ambiguous, messy truths.” 

We are seeking support for the creation of our newest work X RATED PLANET. X will interweave street dance forms including house, popping, waacking, vogueing, breaking, freestyle hip-hop, documentary theater, choreopoetry, original live song, and interactive video to explore sexual violence. X tells stories of trauma, resilience, and triumph by using interviews with cross-generational, racially and gender diverse survivors of sex trafficking and sexual abuse. This work seeks healing from sexual trauma, including the reclamation of sovereignty over one’s body, while using documentary hip hop dance theater and storytelling to challenge pervasive rape culture and contribute to the discourse of the Me Too Movement.   

 

OUR ASK

Our goal is to raise $8,000 to fund this important work. We are reaching out to our community to help close the gap so we can access materials for this magical healing prayer of high level hip hop documentary theater and medicine for our community.

Campaign funds will go directly towards paying Embodiment Project’s dedicated core company members: Terrence Paschal, George “WuKong” Cheng, Amber Julian, Johnny “JRawKit” Nguyen, Sammay Dizon, Dre “Poco” Devis, Keisha Turner, Rama Mahesh “ButtaGod” Hall, singer/songwriter/cultural ambassador Amikaeyla Gaston, sound healer/vocalist/medicine woman gina Breedlove, DJ/sound design XOA, video artist Meena Murugasan, and restorative justice leader Sonya Shah and The Ahimsa Collective (a network of restorative justice pioneers) and EP’s Founder/Artistic Director Nicole Klaymoon.

 

Donors will receive the following exciting perks!

$50 - Your Name on EP's Website

$100 - Your Name of EP's Programs

$200 - Invitation to observe an EP rehearsal and talk to the company!

 

THE IMPACT

19 million sexual trauma survivors recently came forth on twitter by posting "me too". According to Me Too Movement founder, Tarana Burke, how people generally characterize the “me too” movement is incorrect. Her life-affirming work for Black women and global initiative to end sexual violence has in many ways been misrepresented, erased, and relegated to a hashtag.  X RATED PLANET aims to use documentary hip hop theater to honor and uphold Burke’s legacy of critical organizing, as well as center the voices of women of color and survivors. 

Sexual violence is a hidden epidemic. This work challenges pervasive attitudes that demonize those in the roles of “victim” and “perpetrator”; humanize issues of sexual abuse, sex trafficking, structural racism; and bring us closer to root causes of sexual violence. The project draws on restorative justice practices as a methodology for healing everyone impacted by sexual violence and challenges the good/bad dichotomy. 

 

OTHER WAYS TO SUPPORT EP

Just because you can’t contribute funds to doesn’t mean you can’t be a supporter of EP.  Please help get the word about by sharing this campaign on social media using the Indiegogo share tools.

For more information, visit embodimentproject.org

story:
Hello! If you are reading this you may remember that there was already a campaign for this project, a production of Euripides' Medea at ATM Studios in Austin, TX. Well a few things have happened. Firstly, here is the link to the original indiegogo campaign with a summary about what the project is, in case this is the first time you are hearing of this: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/medea--2/x/9093864

As you can see our goal was to raise $2500, and we only raised $820. A big thank you to all who already donated, or even just spread the word about our play! But unfortunately it was not enough, and it clear to us now, with the play two weeks away, that we will need more money to bring our costumes and set design into full reality. This fundraiser will be short and quick. I am setting one week to raise $1250. The final day is Friday the 13th.

Please spread the word about this campaign! Tell as many people as you can! We have many plans and visions for our Greek tragedy revival which we can only accomplish with your help!

Finally- the (new) dates of the play are February 21, 22, 25, 27, 28 and March 1, at ATM Studio in Austin, TX. Hope to see you there!

story:
WHO ARE WE?

We are Great Small Works, a collective of 6 theater artists based in New York City, who explore traditional popular theater and puppet forms to make shows reflecting contemporary life.

http://www.greatsmallworks.org/about/index.html

 WHAT IS TOY THEATER?

Using flat, paper cut-out figures and miniature scenery, Toy Theater (also known as “paper theater” and “model theater”) originated with 19th-century advances in printing and engraving. The original toy theaters of Europe were complete dramas modeled on stage hits of the day, do-it-yourself home entertainment kits containing scripts, characters, and scenery which you could take home, assemble, and perform for friends and family.

 

WHY TOY THEATER?

We discovered the medium during the countdown to the first Gulf War in 1990 when, inspired by Walter Benjamin’s notion of a culture in a permanent “state of emergency,” and responding to the banal terror of the mass media, we began a topical serial drama using texts and images cut from the daily news. This began our engagement with the form, and we have been creating original Toy Theater shows ever since, teaching Toy Theater to people of all ages, and inspiring both performing and visual artists to do their own Toy Theater experimentations.  This is a do-it-yourself storytelling form which can be elaborate yet simple, grand yet inexpensive, full of deep critical thinking yet accessible to all.

 

A TOY THEATER FESTIVAL?

Twenty years ago a few Great Small Workers were hauling stuff across First Avenue in the East Village and thought: if we find this form so compelling, maybe there are other contemporary artists doing the same thing. Why not produce a festival of Toy Theater? Would we find enough performers? Would anyone come? Could there be a museum in the lobby for artists who, perhaps, had made toy theaters but were not performers?

As it turned out, there were lots of toy theater makers, performers, designers, collectors and animators out there. Many did not yet know they would become consumed by the form. Great Small Works' first Toy Theater Festival took place in 1993.

Twenty years of growth – and nine festivals later – Great Small Works is embarking on its 10th International Toy Theater Festival and Temporary Toy Theater Museum at the new St. Ann’s Warehouse at 29 Jay Street in DUMBO, Brooklyn, June 14-23, 2013.

http://www.stannswarehouse.org/current_season.php?show_id=83

As ever, our programs will juxtapose the traditional with the contemporary, and inspire the public to do it themselves. We will present ten days of performances by artists from all around the world and all around the neighborhood—Facto Teatro from Mexico City, New Model Theatre from Ramsgate, England, Janie Geiser from Los Angeles, Erik Ruin from Providence, Clare Dolan from Vermont, Ensemble Pi from Manhattan, Drama of Works from Brooklyn, and many others. The festival will include performances for adult audiences, performances for family audiences, a workshop for all ages, two symposia, and the Temporary Toy Theater Museum, an extensive exhibit of new and historic Toy Theaters, which is open free to the public.

We invite you to join us--step away from your screens and electronic boxes and experience a world of storytelling that can be made of cardboard and has its origins in the Victorian parlor. Hooray for Toy Theater, where we can tell the grandest of tales with the simplest of means!  And Hooray for the Toy Theater Festival—a colossal event of miniature proportions!

Our festival needs money!  Ticket sales cover the costs of marketing and production.  But we need support to host dozens of artists coming from around the globe--airfare, food, local transportation, and visas.  $500 pays for a ticket from Mexico City; $750 pays to rent a mini-van for 10 days; $400 pays for a shared meal in our studio.  We ask you to show your appreciation for these generous artists who will bring their work to Brooklyn.  

Here's How:

SPECIAL BENEFIT EVENT

Great Small Works will host a gala Toy Theater Festival benefit on Thursday, May 23rd, at powerHouse Arena in DUMBO, Brooklyn.  Guest performers include master puppeteer Basil Twist, toy piano virtuoso Margaret Leng Tan and musician Rima Fand.  The storefront will also be filled with truly intimate paper theater plays created and performed by Lake Simons, Toni Schlesinger, Ed Valentine… and many others!  For a $25 Indie GoGo contribution, you will secure a ticket to this Great Small Event!

And, for a $100 contribution, we invite you to a pre-benefit Donors Gathering meal, as well, with sparkling music and sparkling drink.

https://www.facebook.com/events/438235946264629/?ref=22


Please support the Toy Theater Festival by donating here, coming out on the 23rd of May, and attending the many great programs at the festival.

 

We thank you!

Great Small Works Company: John Bell, Trudi Cohen, Stephen Kaplin, Jenny Romaine, Roberto Rossi, Mark Sussman

Benefit Committee: Sarah Blust, Larissa Harris, Daniel Rozsa Lang/Levitsky, Shawna Lucey, Alma Matsuo-Sheppard, Mark Read, Toni Schlesinger, Joe Therrien

Museum Curator: Emmy Bean

story:
The Show:

 After reading a poem by Margaret Atwood (The Line: 5 Variations) NP was inspried to begin creating a new piece exploring lines that existed in their own lives. Upon discovering the the raw and industrial space of Auxiliarly Crossfit, Fragments began its development using site specific awareness paired with aerial dance, movement and text to explore the human condition in relation to lines. 

The team began exploring 2 dimensional and 3 dimensional lines that exist. Including the lines that we see on a page; the physical lines we can create with our bodies, or the invisible divide between what we feel and what we decide to show. 

  With all these questions and curiosities, NP has been on a rollercoaster of creation pushing themselves phyically and emotionally as they navigate their way through this daring and exhilerating process. 

The Team:

Director: Katelyn McCulloch

Stage Management: Sandra Dagovic

Performers and contributors:Brittany Smith, Michela Canon, Katelyn McCulloch, Taliya Cohen, Kadri Hansen

Design: George Quan (lighting), Aaron Bernstein (sound)

What we need:

We have chosen a unique venue to execute this piece; Auxiliary Crossfit. The space is very industrial and raw and while it has been very important to our creation it also holds challenges.  We need help from this campaign to bring in lights and sound into our space. We also need specific aerial equipment to ensure that we can hang safely from the ceiling as we are creating this piece. We also want to make sure we have chairs in which our audience can come, sit and enjoy the show!

Other Ways You Can Help:

Check us out online and learn more about NP. Rehearsal photos, videos and blogs posted weekly! Please spread the word about No Parachute and come check out our show!

Website:

www.noparachutetheatre.com

Facebook:

http://www.facebook.com/NoParachuteTheatre

Or twitter

@noparachuteTO

story:
Photo by Pam Bolig (www.boligphotography.com)

The skinny...

My name is Megan Morse Jans and I am currently an MFA candidate in dance at the University of Maryland College Park.  I am blessed to be able to spend my days speaking about the intricacies of our art form, dancing with amazing friends and colleagues, and serving the student body of the university as a Graduate Teaching Assistant.  The course I teach is Dance Appreciation, where I get to share with my students how dance and culture intertwine and help them see the importance and value of an arts education.  Truly...I'm a lucky gal.

For a long time, I have been a fan of Batsheva Dance Company and very interested in the work of its artistic director Ohad Naharin.  Naharin has created a language of movement he calls Gaga.  It is an improvisational technique that stimulates incredible creativity and feels amazing.  This summer I have the opportunity to study this technique, in depth, at the Gaga Summer Intensive in Tel Aviv, Israel.   

For me, this is the chance of a lifetime.  I am wife and mommy, living my dream of deeply studying my art form, but life as an artist is not exactly...lucrative.  The reality is that on my own, I cannot afford this trip.  I have received funding from the university to attend the intensive, but it will not cover everything.

Through this amazing journey, I hope to not only to have a wonderful and enriching experience as an artist, but to bring back this experience and share it with my students as well. I feel like one of the best gifts I can give them as their teacher, is a worldview.  So please, will you help me see the world? 

What I Need & What You Get...

Through this campaign, I hope to raise $3000 toward my trip to Tel Aviv.  This, along with the funding I will receive from UMD, will pay for travel to Israel, lodging for my two-week stay, tuition for the intensive, local travel to and from the intensive, and food (hey...a dancer's gotta eat, right?)

I've created the following perks for donating:

$10 A thank you note.

I would promise a handwritten one, but my handwriting is so bad I will spare you the strain of trying to interpret it.  I will mail you a thank you note filled with my deepest gratitude!

$25 A postcard from the Holy Land

While I am in Israel, I will send you a postcard from the Holy Land (I will do my best to write legibly)!

$100 A picture of me dancing in Israel (and a postcard)

Not only will I send you a postcard, but also upon my return I will send you a picture along with a written account of my adventures and a-ha moments on this life-changing trip.

$500 A video thank you posted on my website

I will send you a postcard from Israel as well as a picture and reflections on this amazing journey, and I will also create a video retrospective of the trip where I will thank you by name.  It will be posted on my website www.meganmorsejans.com.

In the event that I only raise part of the money, it will still go toward this trip.  I believe firmly that this is an important experience and I am committed to raising this money.  Even if it means I have to have a bikini car wash.  And I am really, really pale so please let's spare the greater Annapolis area the blindness they will all suffer as a result of the glare coming off of me in a bikini, and make this campaign a success by donating.

In the event that you are unable to donate, worry not!  There are still ways you can help.  Please consider sharing my campaign with others.  Spread the word!

Thank you so much for helping me with this project!  I can't wait to share my experiences with you!  To learn more about my work as a teaching artist, performer and choreographer, please visit www.meganmorsejans.com.

For a long time, I have been a fan of Batsheva Dance Company and very interested in the work of its artistic director Ohad Naharin.  Naharin has created a language of movement he calls Gaga.  It is an improvisational technique that stimulates incredible creativity and feels amazing.  This summer I have the opportunity to study this technique, in depth, at the Gaga Summer Intensive in Tel Aviv, Israel.   
For me, this is the chance of a lifetime.  I am wife and mommy, living my dream of deeply studying my art form, but life as an artist is not exactly...lucrative.  The reality is that on my own, I cannot afford this trip.  I have received funding from the university to attend the intensive, but it will not cover everything.
Through this amazing journey, I hope to not only to have a wonderful and enriching experience as an artist, but to bring back this experience and share it with my students as well. I feel like one of the best gifts I can give them as their teacher, is a worldview.  So please, will you help me see the world? 
What I Need & What You Get...
Through this campaign, I hope to raise $3000 toward my trip to Tel Aviv.  This, along with the funding I will receive from UMD, will pay for travel to Israel, lodging for my two-week stay, tuition for the intensive, local travel to and from the intensive, and food (hey...a dancer's gotta eat, right?)
I've created the following perks for donating:
$10 A thank you note.
I would promise a handwritten one, but my handwriting is so bad I will spare you the strain of trying to interpret it.  I will mail you a thank you note filled with my deepest gratitude!
$25 A postcard from the Holy Land
While I am in Israel, I will send you a postcard from the Holy Land (I will do my best to write legibly)!
$100 A picture of me dancing in Israel (and a postcard)
Not only will I send you a postcard, but also upon my return I will send you a picture along with a written account of my adventures and a-ha moments on this life-changing trip.
$500 A video thank you posted on my website
I will send you a postcard from Israel as well as a picture and reflections on this amazing journey, and I will also create a video retrospective of the trip where I will thank you by name.  It will be posted on my website www.meganmorsejans.com.
In the event that I only raise part of the money, it will still go toward this trip.  I believe firmly that this is an important experience and I am committed to raising this money.  Even if it means I have to have a bikini car wash.  And I am really, really pale so please let's spare the greater Annapolis area the blindness they will all suffer as a result of the glare coming off of me in a bikini, and make this campaign a success by donating.
In the event that you are unable to donate, worry not!  There are still ways you can help.  Please consider sharing my campaign with others.  Spread the word!
Thank you so much for helping me with this project!  I can't wait to share my experiences with you!  To learn more about my work as a teaching artist, performer and choreographer, please visit www.meganmorsejans.com.

story:
Over the past three years, Lorem Ipsum has staged four energetic and physical productions of timeless scripts that range from the frivolously ridiculous to the brutally emotional. We roared at the childish absurdity in Jarry's Ubu Roi, wept at the passionate tragedy in Llorca's Blood Wedding, sang along with the dismal dialectic in Brecht's The Threepenny Opera, and squirmed at the stark claustrophobia in Ibsen's Ghosts.

Now, the members of Lorem Ipsum are honored to announce that we will present Erin Shields' award-winning If We Were Birds as part of Portland Stage Company's inaugural Studio Rep series.

Through the lens of a traditional Greek tragedy (the story of Procne, Philomela, and Tereus, from Ovid's Metamorphosis), If We Were Birds confronts the concept of rape as a tool of war, featuring a chorus of women whose words were inspired by testimonials of female survivors from contemporary conflicts. At turns shocking and beautiful, this play is brutally honest, magical, inspiring, and, in the end, surprisingly human.

"When I first read If We Were Birds, I knew immediately that I had to do it. So much about it spoke to me: the beautiful language, which seamlessly melds the ancient and the modern, the timeless relevance of the material, the fact that it offers seven powerful roles for seven powerful actresses, how fearlessly it tackles topics that we often shy away from -- including the hidden costs of war (those that people don't see and those that are concealed), rape, women's lack of agency, how violence is blind to privilege, and the varied, sometimes troubling, ways in which we (try to) heal. I think that it's important to bring these issues to Portland audiences. There are women in this city, including immigrants and refugees, who have dealt with and witnessed scenes like the ones described in the play. Our country is currently at war, but often all we read are sanitized reports of those conflicts, if that. Violence is perpetrated against women in many ways, and I believe we ought to confront that. We need to have these discussions and often art is a catalyst to start them."

- Deirdre Fulton, Director of If We Were Birds and founding member of Lorem Ipsum

Our production features brave performances by some of Portland's most adventurous actors: Karen Ball, Mariah Bergeron, Emma Cooper, Corey Gagne, Mandy Huotari, Heather Elizabeth Irish, Nicholas Schroeder, Lisa van Oosterum, and Ellen Elizabeth White.

We are proud to be collaborating with versatile Portland musician and installation artist Emily Dix Thomas, who previously played with us in the Blood Wedding ensemble. She will be writing an original score for If We Were Birds, and performing it live at all seven performances. With costumes by Hannah Brown, set design by Stacey Koloski, and lighting design by Corey Anderson, this production is bound to be as visually stimulating as it is thought-provoking.

Lorem Ipsum hopes this project will help raise awareness about the pervasiveness of rape during wartime and the lasting effects of sexual violence on all victims. With this in mind, we will be donating $1 per ticket sold, plus advertising space in our program, to Sexual Assault Response Services of Southern Maine (SARSSM).

Your generous support allows us to make these donations, as well as honor our ongoing commitment to keep our ticket prices low and compensate our cast and crew for their hard work.

Please watch our video and consider a donation to this meaningful and beautiful project. We thank you in advance, and look forward to seeing you in the audience,

Lorem Ipsum

(Claire, Corey, Deirdre, Ian, Nick, Mike & Tess)

story:
Welcome to 'The Big Game' where the rules and the outcome are created on stage in real time.
 

 

After a successful premiere help us to continue to perform.

Hi, my name is Sharona Florsheim. I’m the choreographer of ‘The Big Game’ and I invite you to be our partners in bringing this dance event to its fulfillment, and more! 

The Big Game invites the audience to enter an absurd world composed of games which have been made up and are played out by four dancers on stage in real time. The various games expose the emotional world of the dancers and the power relations between them. The piece raises questions about the purpose of the game, who sets the rules and how these rules influence the interaction between the players, how far the players would go to achieve a desired outcome, and what happens if the rules are broken. It questions our sense of free choice and understanding of responsibility as players in our own personal or social games.

We wish to tour The Big Game and perform it to people in outlying communities. We need your help in raising $9,300 and cover the performances basic costs.

We’ve worked in the studio for almost five months and had a very successful premiere a few weeks ago. We’ve partly covered the costs of the production until now and in order to continue to perform this highly communicative dance event, we need your support. We wish to tour all over the country and share The Big Game with people from different backgrounds and communities. To make it happen we need your help to cover the basic expenses of each performance which include the dancers' and musician's wages, travel expenses, theatre rental and administration. When we have the majority of our costs covered we can offer the tickets for a very low price. This is especially relevant when touring to communities where people are less exposed to the art of dance and are economically challenged. These $9,300 are two thirds of the actual budget for 8 performances. The more money we raise the more performances we can do!

The amazing and devoted cast of The Big Game is committed to this social vision. We believe art can make a difference in the heart of everyone. We believe dance is for everyone.

Join us to support this dance event and help us make a difference in our part of the world. We'll appreciate any financial contribution and your help to spread this campaign.

Thank you.

With Love,

Sharona Florsheim and The Big Game cast.

story:
In 2010 Playhouse Creatures made their main stage debut with a successful production of The Libertine by Stephen Jeffreys on New York’s Theatre Row. Now 3 years later we plan to remount it and Present it in collaboration with another theatre company as a Boston premiere! The production will be presented on Sept 6-22, 2013 at the Wimberly Stage at The Calderwood Pavilion - Boston Center for the Arts in collaboration with Bridge Repertory of Boston!

During the past 3 years Playhouse Creatures has employed over 100 artists, presented 3 full productions, 3 staged readings, a Tennessee Williams Festival and launched The Little Creatures Act Out Youth Program. Help us take The Libertine to Boston giving us the opportunity to collaborate and grow with other artists in presenting great theatre!

What We Need:

At least 7 of the original Cast/Crew will be participating in this re-mount. This includes, Company members: Joseph W. Rodriguez, Eric Doss, Sarah Koestner, Megan O’Leary, Eric Tucker, Angela Huff and lighting designer Les Dickert.

We need: to:

  • Pay to Refit and/or create over 15 custom built costumes !
  • Transport our costumes, used set pieces AND ourselves to Boston
  • Provide Lodging in Boston for PCTC performing artists for 8 weeks!
  • and eventually we’d like to come back too! ;)

Remember YOUR CONTRIBUTION IS TAX DEDUCTIBLE!
(you will receive a special receipt automatically upon contributing)

NOTE: This part of our budget is small in comparison to the overall amount of the show’s production budget our producing partners in Boston will be handling.

Help us do our part and choose a great perk from the list below! We promise you won’t be disappointed with the result!

And PLEASE help us share this campaign! Every little bit helps and we need everyone’s support in spreading the word!

story:
Our man Matt (mr. party animal and all around good guy) was left holding the bag at yet another early morning Detroit party raid:(

The underground Detroit family must stand behind Matt and help him fight the good fight for us all! in the words of the late great MCA "you gota fight for your right to party" and so it is we embark on our latest crusade...saving Matt's butt!


As some of the old schoolers we have put together some special incentives as our way of giving back for all the help you have bestowed upon Mr. Abbott!

 

Free limited dj mixes, vip at the next big party, "Ill come wash your car"...lol plus a nifty t-shirt for us saviors of Matt's sorry ass..lol


Please stay tuned to Matt's facebook page for updates and more incentives as we plan our next big moves against the MAN! (https://www.facebook.com/secretsnyc)

"If we as members of the resistance can not learn to turn our personal tragedies into victories for us all we lose as a family" ~LOGIC

 

Lets all put it together for Matt and show this town we have real solidarity and are not to be messed around with by these out of control criminal police! There is real crime to fight in Detroit so leave us dancers and Dj's alone.

Lets all help Matt and Jamie turn this situation into the new method of defending and supporting each other within our community and support a new beginning of rock solid support and creative energy into the Detroit underground music scene! 

 

Peace+love=Detroit forever

~Us

story:
Lord, what food these mortals be!  Bram Stoker’s Dracula collides with Shakespeare's A Midsummer Night’s Dream in a puckishly ‘biting’ woodland mashup where no ruffled neck is safe. Join us, if you dare, for the ORIGINAL douchey teen vampire drama.  The Nightmare 'Dream' comes to the New York International Fringe Festival in August 2013, presented by Bloody Shakespeare.

 

The play, approximately 50 minutes in length, uses text only from the two source works.  Writer/director Neal J. Freeman's original plan was to develop a Midsummer production with a gothic horror setting, to give a playful wink to the idea that the Elizabethans thought of "fairies" in a much more sinister way than we are accustomed to.  Upon beginning to locate the Shakespeare characters within a horror universe, Freeman discovered surprising parallels to the characters in Stoker's Dracula, and The Nightmare 'Dream' was born!

 

Bloody Shakepseare is Neal J. Freeman and producer Heather Siobhan Curran.  We worked together for three years as Executive Director and Artistic Director of Brooklyn's acclaimed The Gallery Players and collaborated there on over a dozen productions.  Having left the organization in May 2012, we are excited to renew our collaboration on the world premiere of The Nightmare 'Dream'.

 

We are working from a budget of $7,500 for this festival production.  The largest part of this goes to paying the actors and creative team for their work, per the terms of the Actors' Equity Association agreement with FringeNYC.  Your contribution here assures we have enough left over to pay for costumes, rehearsal space, and the many other miscellaneous expenses needed to get us to the finish line! 

 

We are excited to offer illustrations by Michael C. Malbrough (who illustrated our logo) as perks for our higher level donors.  Mike will take a photo you provide (of you or another person) and "mash it up" with a horror icon of your choice (Dracula, Frankenstein, whatever you choose) to create a custom caricature just for you! View samples of Mike's work.

 

More about us:  Neal is a member of SDC and holds an MFA in Directing from Brooklyn College and a BA in Theater Arts from Cornell University.  His play A Letter from Bataan was a 2012 and 2013 semi-finalist for the Eugene O'Neill Center National Playwrights Conference.  As Artistic Director of The Gallery Players from 2003-2012, Heather directed, produced, or executive produced dozens of shows during her tenure, earning the theater over two dozen New York Innovative Theater Awards and nominations. She is currently on the board of New York Theatre Barn developing new works and is a member of the League of Professional Theatre Women.

 

Thank you for considering making a donation, and helping us produce the world premiere of this brand new play!

 

Neal & Heather

 

Can't donate?  Please consider joining our email list, becoming a fan on Facebook, and most of all, coming to see the show!

story:
Short Summary

The dance performance InterAct emphasizes the connection between two people and the space they're in. The reason for this performance is to inspire people to use their own imagination about relationships with people and the environment that surrounds them.

My name is Evelien Koekkoek, I'm an interior designer from Amsterdam and besides my passion for interior design I developed a great interest for the human body. To show my vision, that everybody is constantly influenced by other people and the environment they're in, I combined my two passions: interior design and the human body. And I created a dance performance that emphasizes that connection. The dancers are connected through their costume, this limitation becomes an elevation and creates a whole different perspective. 

You will help us to take the next step to develop this dance. 

We need a professional promotion video for a campaign to promote this dance, so we can reach a large audience and let people have this great experience about the interconnection between people who share the same space and time. 

What We Need & What You Get

For the professional promotion video we will need an amount of 1000,- euro, for the promotion campaign we need 250 euro and 200 euro to sew a new costume.

Itai Cohen is already in our team and he is going to shoot the video with professional cinematic equipment. We will shoot the video in a great setting in Amsterdam (you will see it when we are finished) and we need professional lighting for this set. 

We will promote the video online on several social media networks, but we will also perform in public and hand out flyers. 

We will write to several magazines and blogs so they can publish a story about 'InterAct.'

For the video we need a new custom made costume. We can use this costume afterwords for the performances.

This will help us to get to the next step in our development so we can show this innovative dance that you never saw before. 

The Impact

A large audience will receive a great communicating experience where they are challenged to use their imagination. 

We had a lot of positive feedback and now we are ready to fulfill the maximum potential of the dance act. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this video wherever you can  to help us with this campaign.

story:
ZAPTURAPT

Koreografi: Esra Yurttut

Dramaturji: Evren Erbatur

Müzik: Anıl Karaoğlu

Fotoğraf: Murat Dürüm - Barış Muratoğlu

Dançılar/Oyuncular: Salih Usta, Mertcan Semerci, Cemil Can Yusufoğlu, Melis Tuzcuoğlu

İlk Gösterim: Mart 2014, KaST (Kadıköy Sanat Tiyatrosu)

Zapturapt, disiplin ve özgürlük kavramlarının birbirine zıt görünen doğaları arasında gezinerek, bedene ve algıya müdahale edilme haline değinir.

İnsan istekler, beklentiler, zorunluluklar, bedeller, ölçüler ve ölçütler içinde, bilinçli ya da bilinçsiz bir biçimde değişir, değiştirilir, şekil alır ve şekil verir. Peki, bu süreçte kendi hayatını kurmak için gerek duyduğu kuralları, koşulları ve ihtiyaçları nerede bulur? Yeni yöntemler önerebilir mi bu süreç içinde, yoksa ne pahasına ve neye rağmen yaşar? Kendi seçtikleri ile mi kurar, öğretilmiş olanları mı kullanır; ya da her ikisinden yola çıkarak kendine özgü bir dünya mı oluşturur?

Disiplin ve özgürlük arasında fark edilen bu dönüşüm tutku, azim, sabır, sevgi, inanç, korku, yenilgi, adanmışlık, bıkkınlık ve cesaret dolu bir var oluş halidir.

Proje, askeri eğitim ve bale eğitimi arasındaki ortak disiplin anlayışından yola çıkarak, bu var oluş halindeki farkındalığı vurgulamaktadır. 


noland Proje Topluluğu

“dünyalı-dünyasız, ait-ait olmayan, yerli-yersiz, yurtlu-yurtsuz, taraf-tarafsız kelimelerinin ortasında, olduğumuzu düşündüğümüz yere “noland” dedik. Kendi dilinde susan, hareket eden, ses çıkaran, birlikte duran, birlikte olan, daireleri seven, gülümseyebilen insanlar oradadır, kapısız bir yerdir. İçerisi yoktur, kendisi renklidir.”

noland proje topluluğu 2004 yılından beri bağımsız olarak projeler üreten bir oluşumdur. Disiplinlerarası bir yaklaşımda projeler üretmek, grubun sanatsal yaklaşımının ana eksenini oluşturmaktadır. Bu yaklaşımla şimdiye kadar gerçekleştirilmiş projeler, çağdaş dans temeline oturan ve müzik, video, tiyatro gibi farklı sanat disiplinleri ile girişilen ortaklıkların ürünüdür. 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

ZAPTURAPT

Choreography:  Esra Yurttut

Dramaturgy: Evren Erbatur

Music: Anıl Karaoğlu

Photography: Murat Dürüm - Barış Muratoğlu

Performers: Salih Usta, Mertcan Semerci, Cemil Can Yusufoğlu, Melis Tuzcuoğlu

Premiere: March, 2014, KAST (Kadıköy Art Theatre -Kadıköy Sanat Tiyatrosu)

Zapturapt wanders around the nature of the notions of discipline and freedom, which appear controversial to each other, and touches upon state of intervention on body and perception.

Human, in between wants, expectations, musts, prices, measures and standards, consciously or unconsiously, alters, is altered, forms and is formed. But, where does it find the rules, conditions and needs that it needs to set up its life? Can it offer new methods? If not, what is the cost of living, and despite what? Does it establish with the ones that it chooses, does it use the ones that are taught, or does it establish a world -a unique world- synthesizing both?

This metamorphosis, existing between discipline and freedom, is a state of being filled with passion,  determination, patience, love, faith, fear, defeat, commitment, weariness and bravery.

This project, referring to the common discipline apprehension in military and ballet education, emphasizes the awareness in this state of being.


noland Project Company

We define the place as “Noland”, which is located in the middle of the words like “terrestrial-extraterrestrial”, “appurtenant-not appurtenant”, “proper-improper”, “settled-unsettled”, and “neutral-partial”. The people live there, who keep quiet in their own language and make noise, who move and stay together, or who like to spin around and smile. It is a place without entrance, as there is no inside and outside of it. It is a colorful No-land.

Noland Project Group produces independent projects since 2004. Creating projects in an interdisciplinary manner, defines the major axis of the groups approach to art. The projects, which are actualized by means of this approach, base on modern dance and are the products of a cooperation of elements such as music, video and theatre. 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

ZAPTURAPT

Choreographie:  Esra Yurttut

Dramaturgie: Evren Erbatur

Musik: Anıl Karaoğlu

Fotografie: Murat Dürüm - Barış Muratoğlu

Darsteller: Salih Usta, Mertcan Semerci, Cemil Can Yusufoğlu, Melis Tuzcuoğlu

Premiere: March, 2014, KAST (Kadıköy Art Theatre -Kadıköy Sanat Tiyatrosu)

Zapturapt wandert rund um die Art und Weise der Vorstellung von Disziplin und Freiheit, welche kontrovers zueinander erscheinen, und berührt einen Zustand der Intervention auf Körper und Wahrnehmung.

Der Mensch dazwischen will Erwartungen, Anforderungen, Preise, Messungen und Standards, bewusst oder unbewusst, ändert, wird verändert, formt und wird geformt. Aber wo findet er die Regeln, Bedingungen und Notwendigkeiten die er benötigt um sein Leben einzurichten? Kann er neue Methoden bieten? Falls nicht was ist der Preis einer Lebensweise und entgegen was? Errichtet er es mit denjenigen die er auswählt, setzt er diejenigen ein die gelehrt sind oder errichtet er eine Welt – eine einzigartige Welt – die beides in Synthese vereint?

Diese Metamorphose, zwischen Disziplin und Freiheit, ist ein Zustand des Seins der mit Leidenschaft, Determination, Geduld, Liebe, Glaube, Angst, Niederlage, Engagement, Müdigkeit und Tapferkeit gefüllt ist.

Diese Projekt, bezugnehmend zu der verbreiteten Auffassung von Disziplin in Militär und Ballet Ausbildungen, betont die Bewusstheit in diesem Zustand des Seins. 


noland Projektgruppe  

Wir definieren den Ort als "Noland", der sich in der Mitte der Worte wie "irdisch-außerirdisch", "zugehörig-nicht zugehörig", "angemessen-unangemessen", „besiedelt-unbesiedelt“ und „neutral-befangen“ befindet. Dort leben Menschen, die in ihrer eigenen Sprache schweigen und Lärm machen, die sich bewegen und zusammen bleiben, oder die sich gerne im Kreis drehen und lächeln. Er ist ein Ort ohne Eingangstor, dort gibt es kein Inland und kein Ausland. Es ist ein buntes No-land.

Noland-Projektgruppe produziert unabhängige Projekte seit 2004. Erstellen von Projekten in einer interdisziplinären Weise bildet die Hauptachse der Gruppenansatz zur Kunst. Die Projekte, die mittels dieses Ansatzes verwirklicht werden, basieren auf modernen Tanz und sind die Produkte einer Zusammenarbeit von Elementen wie Musik, Video und Theater.


ZAPTURAPT

Chorégraphie: Esra Yurttut

Dramaturgie: Evren Erbatur

Musique: Anıl Karaoğlu

Photographie: Murat Dürüm

Danseurs/Performers: Salih Usta, Mertcan Semerci, Cemil Can Yusufoğlu, Melis Tuzcuoğlu

Première: 2014, KaST (Kadıköy Art Theatre)

Zapturapt traite du fait d'intervenir sur le corps et la perception. Pour ce faire, il évolue entre deux éléments aux natures qui semblent contradictoires; la discipline et la liberté.

L'homme se trouve changé, travaillé et formé par des désirs, des attentes, des obligations, des prix à payer, des échelles de valeur et des critères, qu'il finit par façonner à son tour. Soit, mais au cours de cette évolution, où puise-t-il pour mettre en place les règles, les conditions et les besoins nécessaires à construire sa vie? Se permet-il de proposer de nouvelles méthodes ou continue-t-il malgré tout à vivre, à vivre quoi qu'il arrive? Compose-t-il à partir de ce qu'il choisit lui-même ou se sert-il de ce qu'on lui a déjà appris ou encore, se construit-il un monde propre tout en se basant sur ces deux?

Passion, persévérance, patience, amour, confiance, peur, défaite, dévouement et courage : autant d'éléments qui participent à l'évolution qui a lieu, lors du passage de la discipline à la liberté.

Le projet Zapturapt souligne la conscience de cet état, en partant de la vision disciplinaire commune de l'enseignement militaire et de la danse classique.

noland 

Nous avons appelé noland l'endroit où nous croyons nous situer, au croisement des dualités : terrestre/extra-terrestre, propriété/non propriété, approprié/déplacé, citoyen/apatride, partial/neutre. À Noland les individus sont mobiles et sonores. Ils se taisent dans leur propre langue, partagent  un positionnement, un devenir, ils aiment les cercles et ils arrivent à sourire. Noland est un lieu sans porte, il n'a pas d'intérieur. Il est fait de couleurs.

L'ensemble Noland signe des projets de façon indépendante depuis 2004. La production des projets transdisciplinaires constitue l'essence de son approche artistique. Les pièces réalisées jusqu'à aujourd'hui, suivant cette démarche, associent le théâtre, la vidéo et la musique et dispose de la danse contemporaine comme base.

story:
The Gist:

Anyone who knows me knows that I've devoted my life to dance. Now is the time to give back! I'm heading to Cape Town, South Africa to teach and choreograph for kids in Townships. These kids are living with very little means, but they have happy hearts and love to dance. Many children will struggle to dance, traveling in dangerous conditions to the studio and they may not have had they opportunity to eat that day. But they make it to their dance class, and I will be there to inspire them with the power of movement and art. Some kids from this program have even made it to the professional level internationally. 

Please take a second to watch the YouTube, it will melt your heart. 

What I Need To Make It Happen:

The trip is two weeks, February 1-15 and it is organized through the LEAP Program at St. Mary's College, where I am currently enrolled. Flight, accommodation, and other expenses (roughly $3,200) are not covered and I need some help from you lovelies to  make this happen. I've got to get there and meet these little dancing stars! 

My dear donors will be kept updated on the trip with photos and blog posts, and I know seeing the kids in this video and knowing you helped them will warm your heart.

Can't Give?

You can help by sharing this link on any social media portal you are part of. Just help me get the word out, that's a big help!

story:
Short Summary

Ok here is a short summary of me:

I love small business and I love the arts.  I have done both for over 40 years and as long as that sometimes sounds I still have some kick left in me!  I had a dinner theatre when I was much younger and I learned many of the in's and outs of both a small business and running a theatre.  I have my Masters degree and years of experience in theatre and television, as well as marketing and fund raising.  My goal is to start a bar that has incredible entertainment that is accessible to everyone. A place where artists and audience can meet to create a great experience.

I feel that quite often there is a mysticism to the arts that can intimidate people unfamiliar and thus not be enjoyed.  Theatre in the days of Shakespeare were for the common man and accompanied by a pint, something to nosh and rowdy behavior.  The art experience is a wonderful way to feel emotions, work through issues, connect with the world, find humor in every corner and engage with other humans.  I want to make this a gathering place for artists, for those who love the arts and those who don't yet know how to appreciate them.  By having a great space, the amazing talent in this city, whether it is photography, film, theatre or something else, will have a venue to show their talent,  people that have no experience with the arts will hopefully feel comfortable to give it a shot and those who have the desire without the experience will have a place to learn.


What We Need & What You Get

Your contribution will help make this happen,  You will be a part of impacting people, the city and the artistic community.  Your participation will help directly with the brick and mortar, with the opportunities available for the artistic and will give you something fun and different to experience. So often the creation of a new business, as well as the appreciation of the arts is limited to those with money.  You are allowing the impact of theatre, film, dance and all visual arts to be brought to the masses.


Other Ways You Can Help

Want to help but don't have the cash, well we can still use you!

  • Pass along the information...the more people you tell the closer this will be to happening!  List us on your facebook page, call your mother, email your Uncle Milt.
  • Donate things we can use...drywall, lights, light board, glasses,  tables and chairs....and the list goes on!
  • If you have a skill you think we might be able to use, the skills of an electrician or a plumber, etc. (for free of course)...send us an email and we will put you to work.

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
READ THIS! 

BLUE has generated a large cult following in Orlando and VarieTEASE has become a staple for the community. It is NOW time for the 50th installment! Can you believe it? 

This show happens to fall in line with The Fringe Festival... so the pressure is ON!  BIGGER and BETTER is the goal. Afterall, we have to meet the expectations of Carnivale. 


To put it into PERSPECTIVE... this is where the FUNDING will go..

1. NEW costumes. The Theme is French inspired so the look can go anywhere from school girl to sexy temptress. VarieTEASE is known for it's costuming and it does add up, especially when adding one of a kind pieces.

2. Props and Set. Think of Riding on The Metro (yes the set and the song as well)

(shadows of the Waifs)

3. Dance Rehearsals=  We truly believe in taking care of our dancers and production crew.. and I want make sure they know they are appreciated! A little payment seems to do the trick and helps out with fuel for your car.

DID YOU KNOW?

IT TAKES A VILLAGE to make all of this happen!!!! All involved are dedicated to putting VarieTEASE on the Map as a destination for all to see in Orlando!!!! 

VarieTEASE is innovative, provocative, and gender bending.Through dance, multimedia, drag, and live sound... the audience will live in the journey and feel the power of almost every human emotion. Sometimes the audience may find themselves wandering around in their brain trying to figure it all out. This is called the "VarieTEASE State of Mind"

 "It's an hour of whatever you want it to be" says Blue. "A moment to slip away from reality and get lost if only for an hour." 

The audiences that come to Blue's shows share one commonality- embracing CULTURE.

VarieTEASE provides non-theatre goers a theatre experience and always leaves them wanting more. 

It is an EXPERIENCE not just a show. 

This spectacle will not only be full of surprises, but also promises to be one of the best VarieTEASE to date. Big Statement perhaps, but it is #50!


see media tab for videos and pictures from previous shows.
story_txt:
READ THIS! 
BLUE has generated a large cult following in Orlando and VarieTEASE has become a staple for the community. It is NOW time for the 50th installment! Can you believe it? 

This show happens to fall in line with The Fringe Festival... so the pressure is ON!  BIGGER and BETTER is the goal. Afterall, we have to meet the expectations of Carnivale. 
To put it into PERSPECTIVE... this is where the FUNDING will go..1. NEW costumes. The Theme is French inspired so the look can go anywhere from school girl to sexy temptress. VarieTEASE is known for it's costuming and it does add up, especially when adding one of a kind pieces.2. Props and Set. Think of Riding on The Metro (yes the set and the song as well)(shadows of the Waifs)3. Dance Rehearsals=  We truly believe in taking care of our dancers and production crew.. and I want make sure they know they are appreciated! A little payment seems to do the trick and helps out with fuel for your car.DID YOU KNOW?IT TAKES A VILLAGE to make all of this happen!!!! All involved are dedicated to putting VarieTEASE on the Map as a destination for all to see in Orlando!!!! VarieTEASE is innovative, provocative, and gender bending.Through dance, multimedia, drag, and live sound... the audience will live in the journey and feel the power of almost every human emotion. Sometimes the audience may find themselves wandering around in their brain trying to figure it all out. This is called the "VarieTEASE State of Mind" "It's an hour of whatever you want it to be" says Blue. "A moment to slip away from reality and get lost if only for an hour." The audiences that come to Blue's shows share one commonality- embracing CULTURE.VarieTEASE provides non-theatre goers a theatre experience and always leaves them wanting more. 
It is an EXPERIENCE not just a show. This spectacle will not only be full of surprises, but also promises to be one of the best VarieTEASE to date. Big Statement perhaps, but it is #50!see media tab for videos and pictures from previous shows.

story:
Short Summary

Hello Friends, after moving to downtown Los Angeles over 2 years ago, I was introduced to  Skid Row a 5 block radius housing anywhere between 3,000-6,000 homeless individuals. I began to question who stays down there and why, with the violence and inhumane living conditions what would bring a person into that environment. While volunteering with a few different organizations including the Union Rescue Mission, I was able to meet and have a bit of a better understanding of who some of the residents are and what can happen in a life to take you into such a dark place. 

While some stories are what many people would typically assume including addiction to drugs and mental illness, some of the more surprising situations include people just down on their luck who need a helping hand up.

What We Need & What You Get

The Union Rescue Mission in Skid Row is one of the few facilities that provides shelter to women and children. Inside of the Mission is a women's only space called the Ladies Day Room. This space is a safe place for the women living within the Mission and outside to relax, commune, and occasionally hold events. We would like your help to raise money to give a much needed upgrade to this area. With a new look and feel, we are hoping it can become more of an uplifting space for these women and contribute to positive progress in their recovery and growth.

Other Ways You Can Help

Any amount you are able to donate is helpful, please give if you can.

Even if you can't help out financially that's ok!! Please spread the word, facebook, emails, word of mouth however you know how to pass it along. We are very excited to get started on this project and look forward to seeing the positive changes that come out of it.

You are all greatly appreciated and I look forward to sharing the process.

story:
What is MARVELLOUS?

Elizabeth Nearing and Matt Minnicino collaborate to bring Marvellous, a world premiere play for all ages, to the New York International Fringe Festival this August.  

Marvellous tells the story of Verbatim, an orphan, left on the steps of an ancient abbey in equally ancient Ireland. Put to work writing other people's stories with other people's ink, he develops an insatiable, unquenchable taste for the imaginary, the heroic, and the fantastic, though his own life has never been anything more than boring. Then, one day, Verbatim's humdrum life is turned upside down. When a ship in the air sailing through the sky gets its anchor stuck in the abbey walls, Verbatim climbs up into a new adventure that forces him to lay by his love of telling tales and become brave enough to write his own. An illuminated adventure for all ages. With puppets. And pirates.


The Marvellous Team

Written by Matt Minnicino; Directed by Elizabeth Nearing

Designed by Josh Smith (set); Herin Kaputkin (costumes); Ken Wills (lights)

Michelle Tuite (Stage Manager); Katherine Eboch (Production Manager)

Starring: Ryan Ward; Alex Spieth; Tim Elliott; Amalia Oswald & more

Graphic Design by Kelley Van Dilla


Where is the money going?

Here's the approximate breakdown of what we need to go to Fringe:

  • $700 enrollment fee to be a part of the Fringe Festival
  • $1500 to build a set that can be set up and taken down in 15 minutes
  • $400 to clothe our actors
  • $275 to spread the word
  • $500 for rehearsal time and space
  • $200 for light board operators and a venue supervisor
  • $200 for props and puppets
  • $125 to insure everybody
  • $100 for lighting needs


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word! Share this page, talk about the project, tweet it, Facebook it. Every little bit helps. 
  • Come see the show in August. The more the merrier. We couldn't do any of it without you.

story:
Hello and Thanks for taking a look at our IndieGogo campaign! 

Tickets are on sale now at eventbrite.com!!!!
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/i-catch-you-dreami...
I Catch You Dreaming is a new play by young Puerto Rican playwright Rafael Albarrán in which the universal topics of love, beliefs, sexual awakening  and the coming together of cultures are explored.
We all have dreams and sometimes have to sacrifice what we love most to achieve them. When Dennis and Amanda decide to leave the island of Puerto Rico to pursue professional success on the stages of New York they leave behind, two broken hearts. I Catch You Dreaming examines the consequences of renouncing to honest love for a Dream of success, the harshness that the Latino community still faces when they move to the states to pursue their goals, the gentrification of the city’s neighborhoods, the discrimination against actors of different ethnicity inside audition rooms and the survival skills our community need to learn the hard way.

When all doors are closed what options are left? Dennis and Amanda’s story is a journey that many have followed, a journey that some of us still are. From being part of a stable middle class on the island they leave everything behind to become struggling artist caught within the American Dream.  

About Oomph Productions

We are a new theater company of multicultural background artists and we are excited to present our first production, I Catch You Dreaming.  

THE TEAM...

Written by Rafael Albarran
Directed by Gama Valle 

Featuring: Rafael Albarrán, Amanda Ríos Nieves, Velson D'Souza, John Paul Harkins, Annabel LaLonde, Aaron Pfeiffer & Serena Miller

Production Team: Executive Producer: Maria Ramos, Producer: Mariana Ortiz, Stage Manager:Luis Santiago, Scenic Designer: Angelica Borrero, Lighting Designer: Jason Fok , Costume Designer: Aris Mejias,Sound Designer: Disanto Diaz and Props Designer: France Trishkina 

Press and Public Relations: Beck Lee for Media Blitz 

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE IT! LIKE IT! FOLLOW US! Post your dream in a picture #dreamit #icatchyoudreaming

story:
MmHmm, Laura's newest one woman show, is coming to The Hollywood Fringe Festival! But it needs your help to get there.

About the Show

​Minnie. Mary. Thelma. Martha. Maricela. These are the bad ass women who have raised our protagonist, Jennifer, a recent college graduate who has just been “graped”. Grape is the newest, hottest term out there for grey rape, which is “a sexual assault that does not fit into the stereotypical confines of rape, but where lines of consent have been misconstrued”. Unable to bring her grapist to justice in a court of law, Jennifer decides she must kill him. But she'll need all the help she can get from the women who know her best, the MMHMM. 

Directed by Jessica Lynn Johnson, this will be Laura's second one woman show. It premiered at The Whitefire Theatre's Solofest this past Valentine's Day, and she is ready to bring it to Fringe audiences!

The Budget

Laura needs $1,300 for:

  • Theater Rental - $600
  • Stage Manager - $200
  • Tech Operator - $500
The Impact
This play has the potential to not only change perceptions of how we as a society view and understand rape, but to also help victims understand it wasn't their fault. It's a play about healing, but most importantly allowing oneself to experience all sides of an issue, and grow from it. 
Other Ways to Help
Can't give money? No probelm! Post this on your social media platforms. Get the word out! This play cannot happen without contributions. 
Also, buy tickets! Tickets will go on sale May 1st, so buy buy buy (#N*sync?). And! Keep promoting via social media, and telling friends about this awesome show. The more people in seats to see this show, the bigger the chance it gets to KEEP being seen.

story:
Shalom Leute,


wie ihr bestimmt schon mitbekommen habt, sind die letzten ein zwei Veranstaltungen nicht so super gelaufen.

Bestimmt gab es dafür mehrere Gründe, welche wir nach und nnach aber aus dem Weg räumen wollen.

Im Endeffekt wollen wir doch alle das gleiche : Eine Veranstaltung auf der man Spaß hat,auf der man frei sein kann, auf der man neue liebe,nette Menschen und eventuell auch Freunde kennen lernt.Eine Goa auf der man mal den Alltag hinter sich lässt und einfach man selbst ist, wo man ausgiebig tanzen kann, ohne Stress, ohne Probleme oder sonstige Sachen die einen plagen.


Um die nächsten Veranstaltungen zu diesen Punkten führen zu können, brauchen wir eure Hilfe :

Einige andere und ich kamen auf die Idee, das Psychedelic Theatre mithilfe von Crowdfunding wieder zum Leben zu erwecken und Paskal finanziell unter die Arme zu greifen.Jeder der hier spendet, trägt unmittelbar dazu bei dass es das Psychedelic Theatre noch weiterhin geben wird, dass die letzten Jahre uns gezeigt haben, dass es um mehr als eine normale Party oder einen normalen Freitagabend geht.


Falls jemand noch fragen hat,kann er mich gerne auf Facebook anschreiben (Savas Emengen)



Ich bedanke mich schon mal im voraus bei jedem der sich bereit erklärt mitzuhelfen.Auch ich werde meinen Teil dazu beitragen,so gut es geht mitzuhelfen,dass es das Psychedelic Theatre auch weiterhin in der Zukunft noch geben wird.



Peace and out


Savas :)


PS : der Endbetrag von 2000€ ist rein zufällig gewählt und kein festes Ziel welches wir unbedingt erreichen wollen :)

Denis Novoa nos cuenta su situación, 22años, 70vacas tudancas y una orden de derribo de su única nave, a dia de hoy la nave esta derribada con un documento que permitiria su legalizacion, escuchamos sus palabras en este video, él nos cuenta que es lo que pasa y por qué.

Entretodos podemos ayudarle.
