story:
THANKS TO ALL WHO DONATED! 

We made good showing, though we did not meet our goal.   Even though our campaign is over you can still help our mummers get some dinners by donating to our fund!

Click here to support Feather Gatherers by making a tax-deductible donation to The Drunkard's Wife through Fractured Atlas:

Help Mummers

Short Summary

The Drunkard's Wife, your favorite no-wave mountain music band/ theater company, is embarking on its first full theatrical production-- a show called Feather Gatherers.  New Ohio Theatre will present the show from July 9-12 in their 2014 Ice Factory Festival in New York City (shows at 7 pm!  mark your calendars).  

RIGHT NOW we are raising funds to make this production possible:  in particular, we want  to pay all of our wonderful performers, musicians, designers and technicians for the time and care they will be devoting to this project.   We want to raise $8000 in 30 days.  Help us meet this goal while at the same time snagging for yourself tickets to the show, hand made artifacts, even an invitation to a party at the devil's own house.

The Show:
Enter the Devil, dressed as a Devil. In FEATHER GATHERERS, a Stravinsky vaudeville set in a fictional 1960s Serbia (or is it West Virginia?), The Drunkard's Wife channels Yugoslavian Black Wave film to renovate and recathect Stravinsky's 1918 musical pantomime "L'Histoire du Soldat."    Powered by an all-star orchestral band, FEATHER GATHERERS weaves elements of traditional folk music from the mountains (Balkans, Carpathians and Appalachians), and improvisation, with Stravinsky’s score.  Sonically and narratively, FEATHER GATHERERS transforms a classic Faust story into a rehearsal for a post-communist utopia that holds echoes of the American Shakers’ heaven-on-earth and of Wilhelm Reich’s orgone-energy generating communitarian experiments.  The result is a visionary tale of seduction & abandonment, language & evil, orphans & bassoons, shakers' utopias and ecstatic dancing ! 

FEATHER GATHERERS was conceived and created for The Drunkard's Wife by Craig Flanagin  (known to you from God Is My Co-Pilot)  and Normandy Sherwood (of The National Theater of the United States of America).

The Cast:
This show has a cast of amazingly talented musicians and performers.
FEATHER GATHERERS features a 7 piece band -- trumpet, trombone, clarinet, bassoon, violin, contrabass, and percussion!  In this show, the band plays mountain music from various mountains, excerpts from Stravinsky's score, and original and improvised music.  Musicians include trumpeter Frank London (of the Klezmatics), trombone player Sam Kulik (known for work with Mitra Sumara and Cynthia Hopkins), contrabass player Taylor Bergren-Chrisman  (of Golem), clarinetist Tom Abbott (of Tom Abbott Orchestra) all under the baton of conductor Ben Grow.

The show also features wonderful actors.   Ean Sheehy (lately of Red Eye to Havre de Grace and NTUSA fame) portrays The Narrator!   Jess Barbagallo (of Half Straddle and Big Dance Theater) portrays The Soldier!  Juliana Francis Kelly (OBIE award winner who has performed with Richard Foreman/ Reza Abdoh) portrays the Devil!  Lillie Jayne (AKA Admiral Grey, singer of Cellular Chaos among others) portrays the Orphan!  Nikki Calonge (of performance group ANIMALS) portrays the Urchin!  And Edgar Oliver (of In the Park at Axis Theatre) portrays The Audience!   Also:  a troupe of mysterious dancers and mummers led by our own Lilia Sotirova! 

Not to mention designers and technicians ~  In addition to Drunkard's Wife costume/set/props design crew (Normandy and Craig) we have the wonderful Sarah Johnston designing lighting,   the multi-faceted Allison Plamondon making choreography, and the capable and canny Sophie Talmadge Silleck as our Stage Manager.

What We Need & What You Get

Help us make this production a reality:  we need to pay these fine artists fairly!  The artists we are working with are to a one amazing, and have already donated a lot of their (limited,  sought after) time and good will to this project during the course of its development over this past year. 


These are great, generous people BUT  they are also incredibly talented professionals who have to be compensated as such.   We hope, with your help, we will meet our fundraising goal!  but even if  we don't,  100% of net funds raised on indiegogo will go towards artist's fees. 

If you donate..... you can get, in addition to the huge satisfaction of helping us create this new work, a variety of things:

$25: a download of a special thank you song by the Drunkard's Wife, and our infinite good will.

$35:   1 ticket to the show.  Also: a download of a special thank you song by the Drunkard's Wife, and our increasingly infinite good will.

$100: 2 tickets to the show. And The Drunkard's Wife's album, I Saw The Evil One -- in hand made limited edition.

$150:   2 tickets to the show and and The Drunkard's Wife's album, I Saw The Evil One  plus a mix CD of songs from Craig Flanagin's extensive and arcane 78. rpm collection of Eastern European dance tunes.  And:  we'll invite you to our Devil party .

$300:  2 tickets to the show and The Drunkard's Wife's album, I Saw The Evil One,  plus a mix CD of songs from Craig Flanagin's extensive and arcane 78rpm collection of Eastern European dance tunes.  PLUS a fancy-dress hat inspired by the films of Sergei Parajanov and made by Normandy Sherwood-- you can wear it to our party (you're invited).

$500:  2 tickets to the show and The Drunkard's Wife's album, I Saw The Evil One,  plus a mix CD of songs from Craig Flanagin's extensive and arcane 78rpm collection of Eastern European dance tunes.  PLUS a fancy dress hat made by Normandy Sherwood-- you can wear it to our party (you're invited). PLUS your name, sung aloud with ardor, somewhere in the play.

$1000:    In addition to all of the things mentioned above,  here's what we can do for you (choose one):  a.)The Drunkard's Wife  will play your party/ business meeting/ family reunion/  whatever for free.  b.) NRS will mentor your writing project (any writing project!  good for procrastinators!  she teaches college students!)  c.) Craig Flanagin will build you a very beautiful shelf unit (or, if you prefer, an electronic instrument).

$2000:  You get a producing credit. And: in addition to everything mentioned above, choose TWO: a.)The Drunkard's Wife  will play your party/ business meeting/ family reunion/  whatever for free.  b.) NRS will mentor your writing project (any writing project!  good for procrastinators! she teaches college students!)  c.) Craig Flanagin will build you a very beautiful shelf.  Or instrument.

The Impact

This is the Drunkard's Wife's first big show, and it is the culmination of a line of creative work (musical and theatrical) we've been pursuing for the last 5 years.   We are so excited to be able to take it to a revered venue (The New Ohio Theatre's Ice Factory Festival) where it can meet the public!  But in order for this production to succeed, to be successful by our lights,  the artists need to be paid, and fairly.  You, dear friends, can help us make that happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

Artists need to be paid in dollars, but there are other ways you can help our production if you don't have many dollars...
-- Let us rehearse at your house/in your studio.
-- Do you have some extra bottles of wine?  Donate them to our party.
-- Do you have some beautiful carpets? Let us borrow them for the show (they will not be harmed).
-- Do you have a lot of wood or paint?   Do you have a lot of fabric?  Let us use it.
-- Do you have a video camera?  Consider donating a few hours of videography.
-- Do you have other skills?  Could you lend a hand  with costumes? Props?  Sets?  Something else?

-- And of course, you can help us by spreading the word about Feather Gatherers and our campaign!
story_txt:
THANKS TO ALL WHO DONATED!  
We made good showing, though we did not meet our goal.   Even though our campaign is over you can still help our mummers get some dinners by donating to our fund!Click here to support Feather Gatherers by making a tax-deductible donation to The Drunkard's Wife through Fractured Atlas:Help MummersShort SummaryThe Drunkard's Wife, your favorite no-wave mountain music band/ theater company, is embarking on its first full theatrical production-- a show called Feather Gatherers.  New Ohio Theatre will present the show from July 9-12 in their 2014 Ice Factory Festival in New York City (shows at 7 pm!  mark your calendars).   RIGHT NOW we are raising funds to make this production possible:  in particular, we want  to pay all of our wonderful performers, musicians, designers and technicians for the time and care they will be devoting to this project.   We want to raise $8000 in 30 days.  Help us meet this goal while at the same time snagging for yourself tickets to the show, hand made artifacts, even an invitation to a party at the devil's own house. The Show:Enter the Devil, dressed as a Devil. In FEATHER GATHERERS,
a Stravinsky vaudeville set in a fictional 1960s Serbia (or is it West
Virginia?), The Drunkard's Wife channels Yugoslavian Black Wave film to
renovate and recathect Stravinsky's 1918 musical pantomime "L'Histoire du
Soldat."    Powered by an
all-star orchestral band, FEATHER GATHERERS weaves elements of traditional folk
music from the mountains (Balkans, Carpathians and Appalachians), and
improvisation, with Stravinsky’s score. 
Sonically and narratively, FEATHER GATHERERS transforms a classic
Faust story into a rehearsal for a post-communist utopia that holds
echoes of the American Shakers’ heaven-on-earth and of Wilhelm Reich’s
orgone-energy generating communitarian experiments.  The result is a visionary tale of seduction &
abandonment, language & evil, orphans & bassoons, shakers' utopias and ecstatic
dancing !  FEATHER GATHERERS was
conceived and created for The Drunkard's Wife by Craig Flanagin  (known to you from God Is My Co-Pilot)  and Normandy Sherwood (of The National Theater of the United States of America). The Cast:This show has a cast of amazingly talented musicians and performers. FEATHER GATHERERS features a 7 piece band -- trumpet, trombone, clarinet, bassoon, violin, contrabass, and percussion!  In this show, the band plays mountain music from various mountains, excerpts from Stravinsky's score, and original and improvised music.  Musicians include trumpeter Frank London (of the Klezmatics), trombone player Sam Kulik (known for work with Mitra Sumara and Cynthia Hopkins), contrabass player Taylor Bergren-Chrisman  (of Golem), clarinetist Tom Abbott (of Tom Abbott Orchestra) all under the baton of conductor Ben Grow.The show also features wonderful actors.   Ean Sheehy (lately of Red Eye to Havre de Grace and NTUSA fame) portrays The Narrator!   Jess Barbagallo (of Half Straddle and Big Dance Theater) portrays The Soldier!  Juliana Francis Kelly (OBIE award winner who has performed with Richard Foreman/ Reza Abdoh) portrays the Devil!  Lillie Jayne (AKA Admiral Grey, singer of Cellular Chaos among others) portrays the Orphan!  Nikki Calonge (of performance group ANIMALS) portrays the Urchin!  And Edgar Oliver (of In the Park at Axis Theatre) portrays The Audience!   Also:  a troupe of mysterious dancers and mummers led by our own Lilia Sotirova!  Not to mention designers and technicians ~  In addition to Drunkard's Wife costume/set/props design crew (Normandy and Craig) we have the wonderful Sarah Johnston designing lighting,   the multi-faceted Allison Plamondon making choreography, and the capable and canny Sophie Talmadge Silleck as our Stage Manager. What We Need & What You GetHelp us make this production a reality:  we need to pay these fine artists fairly!  The artists we are working with are to a one amazing, and have already donated a lot of their 
(limited,  sought after) time and good will to this project during the 
course of its development over this past year. These are great, generous people BUT  they are also incredibly talented professionals who have to be compensated as such.   We hope, with your help, we will meet our fundraising goal!  but even if  we don't,  100% of net funds raised on indiegogo will go towards artist's fees.  If you donate..... you can get, in addition to the huge satisfaction of helping us create this new work, a variety of things:$25: a download of a special thank you song by the Drunkard's Wife, and our infinite good will. $35:   1 ticket to the show.  Also: a download of a special thank you song by the Drunkard's Wife, and our increasingly infinite good will. $100: 2 tickets to the show. And The Drunkard's Wife's album, I Saw The Evil One -- in hand made limited edition.$150:   2 tickets to the show and and The Drunkard's Wife's album, I Saw The Evil One  plus a mix CD of songs from Craig Flanagin's extensive and arcane 78. rpm collection of Eastern European dance tunes.  And:  we'll invite you to our Devil party .$300:  2 tickets to the show and The Drunkard's Wife's album, I Saw The Evil One,  plus a mix CD of songs from Craig Flanagin's extensive and arcane 78rpm collection of Eastern European dance tunes.  PLUS a fancy-dress hat inspired by the films of Sergei Parajanov and made by Normandy Sherwood-- you can wear it to our party (you're invited). $500:   2 tickets to the show and The Drunkard's Wife's album, I Saw The Evil One,  plus a mix CD of songs from Craig Flanagin's extensive and arcane 78rpm collection of Eastern European dance tunes.  PLUS a fancy dress hat made by Normandy Sherwood-- you can wear it to our party (you're invited). PLUS your name, sung aloud with ardor, somewhere in the play. $1000:    In addition to all of the things mentioned above,  here's what we can do for you (choose one):  a.)The Drunkard's Wife  will play your party/ business meeting/ family reunion/  whatever for free.  b.) NRS will mentor your writing project (any writing project!  good for procrastinators!  she teaches college students!)  c.) Craig Flanagin will build you a very beautiful shelf unit (or, if you prefer, an electronic instrument). $2000:  You get a producing credit. And: in addition to everything mentioned above, choose TWO: a.)The Drunkard's Wife  will play your party/ business meeting/ family 
reunion/  whatever for free.  b.) NRS will mentor your writing project 
(any writing project!  good for procrastinators! she teaches college students!)  c.) Craig Flanagin will build you a 
very beautiful shelf.  Or instrument. The Impact
This is the Drunkard's Wife's first big show, and it is the culmination of a line of creative work (musical and theatrical) we've been pursuing for the last 5 years.   We are so excited to be able to take it to a revered venue (The New Ohio Theatre's Ice Factory Festival) where it can meet the public!  But in order for this production to succeed, to be successful by our lights,  the artists need to be paid, and fairly.  You, dear friends, can help us make that happen. 
Other Ways You Can HelpArtists need to be paid in dollars, but there are other ways you can help our production if you don't have many dollars...-- Let us rehearse at your house/in your studio.-- Do you have some extra bottles of wine?  Donate them to our party.-- Do you have some beautiful carpets? Let us borrow them for the show (they will not be harmed).-- Do you have a lot of wood or paint?   Do you have a lot of fabric?  Let us use it.-- Do you have a video camera?  Consider donating a few hours of videography.-- Do you have other skills?  Could you lend a hand  with costumes? Props?  Sets?  Something else?-- And of course, you can help us by spreading the word about Feather Gatherers and our campaign!

story:
A museum experience like never before. Transport yourself back in time to the day The Portland Vase was first created 2000 years ago and watch as its secrets are unraveled. 


The Maverick Theatre Company presents a new play “189 Pieces!” at The British Museum.

At Maverick we are committed to excellent theatre in extraordinary places, therefore, we introduce to you, with great delight, our new show developed and directed by Katie Merritt and written by Sue Blundell: “189 PIECES!”

2014 sees the 25th anniversary of the last restoration of The Portland Vase, a Roman glass masterpiece bought by the Dowager Duchess of Portland in 1784. 

In 1845, while on loan to the British Museum, it was deliberately smashed by a visitor! 

Our pioneering show “189 pieces” is a fascinating and dramatic celebration of the extraordinary and significant 2000 year history of one of the most celebrated and important artifacts at The British Museum. 

This quirky, fast-paced and witty piece gives us an insight in to the life of The Vase, the places it has been, and the characters it has encountered throughout two millennia of its existence, as well as a few words from The Vase herself!  

What makes this such a ground breaking show is that it is a development of the traditional museum experience allowing the audience to interact and immerse within the story, enhancing the cultural learning experience and bringing The Vase and its astonishing history to life. By transposing the story into a theatrical medium, the story becomes animated and vibrant, appealing to a wider audience and strengthening and expanding its legacy.

Sue Blundell is a writer and lecturer in classical studies, where she has found inspiration within her work with ancient myths, philosophical ideas and an array of rich and interesting artifacts. Sue came across Maverick Theatre Company and Director Katie Merritt at Maverick's production of “Under Milk Wood” at The Wheatsheaf, Fitzrovia on the 60th anniversary of Dylan Thomas's death last year. 

Sue and Katie’s collaboration has been a particularly successful one, bringing together different styles and thoughts to the development of the script., both are now very excited to execute the project utilising elements of physical theatre, puppetry and interactive theatre.

BUT WE NEED YOUR HELP. 

We would like the opportunity to make as much of the show as possible with a budget to pay the actors, director, rehearsal space and to produce flyers to promote the show and the interactive theatre concept at the museum.

Our Target is £2950

5 professional actors playing 28 parts in total.

Costumes

Rehearsal Space 

Set Design

Marketing Costs and Expenses

Our main priority is to pay the actors for their time and endeavour to perform this pioneering play and learning concept.

Our future plans are to create similar shows in collaboration with the British Museum and other Museums that look at the untold histories of important artIfacts that entertain, inspire and develop cultural knowledge and diversity,

Even a small donation through our Indiegogo campaign will be greatly appreciated or if you prefer to make a donation by phone please call us on 07581586022, and together we can make sure the memory of The Portland Vase lives on!

If not, we do understand, but please do share our link on your Facebook and Twitter, using the Indiegogo share tools, to get the word out about us and what we are trying to achieve. Please do tweet us on @LondonLiteraryPubs.

Alternatively, please do come and see the show and tell us what you think! To BOOK follow the link below.

http://www.britishmuseum.org/whats_on/events_calendar/event_detail.aspx?eventId=1752&title=189%20pieces:%20The%20Portland%20Vase&eventType=Performance

Maverick Theatre is a registered charity, dedicated to increasing access to the performing arts. It has won acclaim for its work and for attracting new, non-theatre audiences. 

Every penny you can spare will go to make living art in the capital city and if you would like to know more about Maverick and future projects, please don't hesitate to get in touch.

Best wishes and many thank for taking the time to read this page.

Katie Merritt MFA

Associate Director

Maverick Theatre Company

07581586022

Maverick Theatre Company is a Registered Charity No. 1143050

story:
LOG LINE

Women Rules depicts a world where gender roles are swapped.  Women play the role of what usually Men do in real life & Men play the role of what Women do in real life.

SYNOPSIS

Film deals with the 3 stories. We follow the lives of Jennifer, Shelly, Chelsea & Claire. 

They all living in Men's world. Jennifer is 8 months pregnant and married to Keith.  They are madly in love with each other & dreaming of their 1st child but soon Jennifer's heart breaks when she finds out about Keith's affair with another girl.

Shelly has been married to Joseph for long time. They have no children.  Shelly has accepted the life of an abused wife.

Chelsea & Claire work together as a bartenders.  They are both visually raped by many of their customers until one day Claire gets Raped & killed for real.

How would Men react if they were in the position of the women in these stories? 

Writer/Director  Vinay Pujara.

Statement : It took me over 1 year to write the script for Women Rules. Initially Women Rules was a short film but then thought that it would not do justice to the characters to wrap them in just 25-30 mins. Hence we decided to wait a little longer & pitch for feature instead. Under my production company Sun Om Productions we have made 5 short films in 2013, all Written/Produced/Directed by me. All the previous films have very diverse subjects with a social message.

Women Rules by far was the most difficult script to write for me. It will be  even more difficult to film. It deals with the issues Women face in 2014 where gender equality is only on paper. Even today Women go through gender inequality in many aspects of their lives. This includes but is not limited to  Abuse/ Sexual harassment/ Molestation/ and are considered to be a weak gender in general. 

This film is by no means to offend any person/gender. This is a fictional world but the concepts in the film definitely deserve a moment in everyones time to be thoughtfully reflected on.

Short Film: Living with Imperfections

Short Film: Sacrifice

Short Film: Love Expired

Short Film: Miss India International ( under post-production )

Short Film: The other side of New York ( coming soon )



CAST

Natalie Pavalek


Erin Callahan

Nisha Kalamdani

Ania Jarda


Cory Boughton


Hesh Sarmalkar

Alejandro Martinez


Sumend Wankhede


THE SUM-UP:

We are seeking a minimum of $20,000 for this campaign.   

Specifically, this campaign is geared at the production of the movie. As soon as possible, we need to:

·  Pay the actors and crew

·  Rent out locations and equipment

·  Pay for food and transportation

THE DETAILS:

All funds will go towards the project.  If we exceed our goal, we'll have more funds available to fund us for Post Production. If we do not reach our goal the process will take longer, but we are dedicated to making this movie happen.

And some of the Merchandise comes with the perks....

Cap 

T - Shirt in White / Black. 

Coffee Mug

Tote Bag


Hoodie in White / black / blue.



Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Sennyo is coming to Los Angeles! Be part of the journey and help us get her here!

Sennyo is a wonderful person and a dedicated and talented flow artist who has spent the past couple of years living and working in Maine.  Late this year, Sennyo decided it was time to move forward, making plans with us to move to Runway studios here in LA. We want to invite the community around us all to be part of the transition by gifting her the funds she needs to make the move into Runway Studios Los Angeles, a full time training space.

Remy Holwick and Jennifer Ong are putting this effort together with help from Ryan Mellors and Marvin Ong.  Sennyo means a lot to all of us, and we can not wait to see what she will create with the access to training space and a supportive community, as a part of the Runway family.

This campaign is very simple, and we are so grateful you are choosing to be part of it.  We love Sennyo and we want her to be part of our community.

This funding will go directly to Sennyo to pay the bill for her travel expenses, so that she can cross the country comfortably and safely. 


We started this campaign as a surprise for Sennyo, but she found out pretty quickly and wants everyone to know that any funds raised beyond gas, food, and accommodations will go to getting her car tuned up and road-trip ready.


We hope you can pass even 1 dollar our way (that covers up to 6 miles of highway driving, guys! It's a big deal!) but even if all you can do is post a comment sending love and support, we would be so grateful!

story:
Short Summary

Crunch: 

Three best friends from high school, run aground on shitty jobs and instability in their early twenties, try to keep their adolescent love for each other alive while caring for a fourth friend who has become a powerful, ravenous, cave-dwelling entity. Even worse, the neighborhood gay bar is a total ghost town and the Target is closed. 'Crunch' explores the intimacy and pressures of female friendship, the complexity of looking for justice when there's no clear place to put blame, and 101 fun and easy ways to cling to heterosexuality by your fingernails.

Waxworks:

A group of excited, exhausted, hopeful Millenials who make way too many jokes about Brecht. They met at colleges and theaters around Los Angeles and, against all prudent advice, decided to spend every free moment making the best theater they can. Waxworks is a company well-versed in American classical and international leftist theater, and has big plans to play with formal and relational boundaries once they find a place to rehearse.


 

What We Need & What You Get

 We are doing this show for the 2018 Company Creation Festival at Son of Semele. It is happening. The show has been developed, rehearsed, and is just about ready to be put up. We need your help to make this show look and sound as amazing as possible. We have to buy too many ladybugs and would like to be able to pay our crew.

For your donations you will receive various perks from Creature Beth premonitions written by our badass lady writer to patches and posters designed by our resident lady artist.

 

The Impact

Crunch has a lot to say about living under immense situational pressure and internal emotional torsion, which we think are things a lot of our audience is living through and chewing over this year. If you know the horror of working retail, being closeted, or watching friends drift away, come on over and let us hurt your feelings some more. If you want to revisit the wide-open happiness of your first love, your favorite terrible bar, or just the REI, we have the show for you, and we need the money to get you a chair to watch it on. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Come see our Show! This is the biggest way you can help other than donating. We want to show you Crunch!

You can get your tickets here: http://www.sonofsemele.org/

Can't donate? That's okay! We love support of any kind.

  • Please Share our Campaign!
  • Like our Facebook page and Follow us on Instagram and Twitter: @crunchtheplay
  • and again you can get your tickets here: http://www.sonofsemele.org/

story:
Artist Statement

Montreal-born but raised on the East coast, Michele returned to her roots to pursue her education in dance at Concordia University. Upon exploring her creativity within 4 years of study she realized the ocean had a larger affect on her than initially thought with the image of the power and fluid nature of waves crashing against a Nova Scotian shoreline influencing her movement. Physical in nature with a focus on Power and femininity, her movement creates a dialogue between fluidity and strength. While very interested in exploring the capabilities of the human body and with an apparent focus on movement, her drive to create stems from personal experiences bound by emotion. Her interest in the similarities and differences between our emotional reactions as civilized beings and those of animals influences her movement choices. Music and musicality always play a large role in her process whether it be sourced from an inner rhythm or external forms; this along with her admiration for lines comes from an extensive early education in Ballet.

 

The Project

Being accepted into an independent study has given me the opportunity to explore the kinds of obstacles and challenges I will be facing working as a choreographer in todays world. With the supervision of a Professor, I hope to overcome some of these challenges while working on my first ever full length dance piece. This experience will act as a stepping stone on my way to life as what I hope to be, a successful artist. This however is just my individual vision. Since this project has began, the idea of presenting this full length work as part of a two evening long event involving another very talented choreographer Sophia Wright, and other visual artist has taken off. The goal of this event is to allow for graduating, up and coming artist to present their work outside of the walls of Concordia where they have been educated, and feed it to the vast artistic communities of montreal, in a safe fun, multidisciplinary environment.

 

What We Need

 

Now down to the nitty gritty, What will your donations be buying?

-One of our most important expenses s space. We are on the hunt for a a specific open space in order to properly organize our performances, and the work of invited visual artists.

-Due to our space idea restrictions, a classic theatre is somewhat out of the question, this means more money will be needed in order to obtain and install lighting and sound equipment.

-I would like to think I'm a jack of all trades, HOWEVER I don't think I will be able to commit to Choreographing, Dancing, and being a Lighting and Music Technician for all of this exciting equipment. These brilliant technicians deserve to be paid, and whats the point of a dance show if you're left in the dark!?

-Who likes beer? We do, and we assume you do. We would love if you'd stick around after the performances have a drink, and talk with us while viewing the visual work on the walls from the no doubtedly talented artists invited.


- Finally, although with public media, the internet and everyone glued to their smart phone these days, how nice is it to see a well designed poster on your nearest community pinboard, or a well thought out video tease? These could be just the things we need to get people saying "I wanna see THAT show".

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Poor student like me? Still want to show your support some how? No problem!!! Share this page or the event page (link to come) with friends and family!
story_txt:
Artist Statement
Montreal-born but raised on the East coast, Michele returned to her roots to pursue her education in dance at Concordia University. Upon exploring her creativity within 4 years of study she realized the ocean had a larger affect on her than initially thought with the image of the power and fluid nature of waves crashing against a Nova Scotian shoreline influencing her movement. Physical in nature with a focus on Power and femininity, her movement creates a dialogue between fluidity and strength. While very interested in exploring the capabilities of the human body and with an apparent focus on movement, her drive to create stems from personal experiences bound by emotion. Her interest in the similarities and differences between our emotional reactions as civilized beings and those of animals influences her movement choices. Music and musicality always play a large role in her process whether it be sourced from an inner rhythm or external forms; this along with her admiration for lines comes from an extensive early education in Ballet.
 
The Project
Being accepted into an independent study has given me the opportunity to explore the kinds of obstacles and challenges I will be facing working as a choreographer in todays world. With the supervision of a Professor, I hope to overcome some of these challenges while working on my first ever full length dance piece. Other Ways You Can Help
Poor student like me? Still want to show your support some how? No problem!!! Share this page or the event page (link to come) with friends and family!

story:
About Chronicles of the Uterus

Chronicles of the Uterus speaks about the secondary functions of the uterus, other than sustaining life, its capacity to create destroy and preserve.

Dark pregnancy : the destruction, is the first story of the trilogy followed by Mrs Chambers and the brain: the preservation and P: the creation.

My purpose is to film a video of the piece with cinematic qualities that will capture the trepid intimacy. The piece can be submitted to film or choreography festivals. All the funding raised in this campaign will go to film Dark Pregnancy only and will go to pay for the venue, collaborator's fees and post production.

 

 

Creating Awareness

This project creates awareness of the importance of the uterus in a woman's life, this pieces is an ode to the organ. According to ancient cultures, the uterus is considered an organ of direct apprehension of knowledge, without having to pass through a thought process, it could facilitate pure perception. It is strongly connected with power and creativity. In addition, the uterus plays a role in hormonal regulation, sexual satisfaction as well as bowel and bladder functions; its removal is not advisable.

On the contrary , modern medicine considers the organ has no value after a woman's child bearing years. This though process has been transfered to woman themselves-they consider there is no purpose of keeping the organ after having chidren if the is any dysfunction with it.

We need to understand how subtle and at the same time how obvious to preserve the uterus is, for the spiritual, mental and emotional well being of women and ultimately of society. 

 

 

About the Artist

My name is Catherine Correa, I was born in Bogota, Colombia. I am a dancer
and physical actor. At three-years-old, without a conscious decision, I decided
to be a dancer. With time, and an absolutely conscious decision, I decided to
become an anthropologist. It was a waste of time. The hand of Terpsichore took
me firmly, and I had no choice but to be an artist.

After years of classic training in ballet and contemporary movement, I continued
my artistic exploration in New York City. While exploring different elements of
dance I added tango to my repertoire
 After years of performing dance, it led me to explore theater. I
began to work as a physical actor – incorporating my long history of movement
into my work as a stage actor.

After working as artist in New York for more than fourteen years, I am thankful
to have had, and still have, the opportunity to work with amazing and talented
actors, choreographers and directors.

This is my first independent performance project.

I know sometimes money is short and being an artist you get to live it more vividly, but I will be very very happy if you can spread the word about the project and if you can donate at least $1 it will be like having coffe together.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

story:
RICHARD III AT FAIRY LAKE

Pell-Mell Players presents Richard III at Fairy Lake (in Newmarket, Ontario), with 2 performances FREE to the public.

“March on, join bravely, let us to’t pell-mell! If not to heaven, hand in hand to hell!”

Our company is composed entirely of committed volunteers who are all local residents of the Newmarket area. Our diverse experiences with Arts Huron, Pickering College, Resurgence Theatre and other local theatre programs have moved us to continue a life in the theatre right here in our home-town.

WHAT: --   RICHARD III (by William Shakespeare)

                  2 live, open-air performances

                  FREE to the public

WHERE: -- Fairy Lake Amphitheatre, Newmarket, Ontario Canada

WHEN: --   Tuesday, August 6th, 2013 – 7:30 p.m.

                  AND

                  Thursday, August 8th, 2013 – 7:30 p.m.

HOW: --    With the support of our patrons and sponsors!

The words of William Shakespeare belong to everyone and our community has been so nurturing to its young artists that we would like to give back with free theatre.

Richard III was in the news this year for the first time in centuries, bringing added relevance to Shakespeare’s darkly comic portrayal of the first, true supervillain in its title character. Young audiences in the Newmarket area are primed to have a young anti-hero in their midst.

WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT …

In Shakespeare’s time, plays were performed not only for the nobles who could afford a cushion, but for the groundlings that paid a penny and were treated to the same spectacle as the royal court. We’re reaching high and low, the same way Shakespeare did, and offering our two performances in August, open and FREE-to-the-public on a “pay-what-you-can” basis. And for this, we need patrons!

Your support makes it possible for us to offer two performances FREE to the public at the Fairy Lake Amphitheatre (Newmarket, Ontario).

It’s on-ground seating in the beautiful amphitheatre area of Fairy Lake – so don’t forget to BYOB (Bring Your Own BLANKET), lawn chairs or pillows to maximize your comfort and enjoyment of this unique outdoor theatre experience.

We are offering rewards of two types: Production Rewards (related to how the production was developed), and Audience Rewards (to make your performance attendance as comfortable and enjoyable as possible.) Donations from supporters will be rewarded at different levels as outlined in the Campaign Perks.

We understand that not all our patrons will be able to attend the Newmarket performances, and we appreciate your support as a patron of our production. If you plan to attend one (or more) of the performances, please let us know (richardatfairylake@gmail.com) and your rewards will be waiting for you at the Amphitheatre when you arrive.

YOUR PATRONAGE SUPPORTS …

Our fund raising target looks to cover the direct costs for two performances in our local community in August 2013. 

                            

If we exceed our funding target, any additional funds raised will be used to produce a short film about Richard’s relationship with his wife Lady Anne. If funding is available, video production is scheduled for autumn 2013, at the Sharon Temple in Sharon, Ontario.

Our abridged script takes Shakespeare’s almost four-hour epic, and condenses it for an audience familiar with fast-paced TV dramas or action movies. This has streamlined the text into a form that is entertaining from beginning to end, for Shakespeare aficionados and newcomers alike.

We hope that our work this summer will provide a template to encourage other local artists to perform plays in public on a volunteer basis regardless of the presence of established theatre companies. The torch has been passed down to a new generation of young artists and it is our responsibility to keep theatre alive in our area. We have embraced this responsibility wholeheartedly and hope our work might inspire other artists to do the same. 

The Pell-Mell Players would like to extend our sincere thanks to all the members of our community that have brought this project to life. We are eager to show our gratitude to the community by sharing some of the most beautiful poetry ever written and one of the most enticing characters in all of Shakespeare.

We hope that this project will be the continuation of Shakespeare at Fairy Lake -- one of Newmarket’s greatest traditions -- and we would like to thank you for your support.

“March on, join bravely, let us to’t pell-mell! If not to heaven, hand in hand to hell!”

story:
Short Summary

Our NYC Boylesque troupe was born in January 2019 and we’ve been going strong ever since. To have a platform for an alternative show, created by two queer performers, and have the ability to showcase LGBTQIA+ performers from NYC and around the world is priceless! It makes us incredibly happy that we have a stage for performers of all walks in the LGBTQIA+ family, and with your help we can branch out and have a larger impact.

What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming to raise more money so that we can copyright our company and continue to bring you quality shows that have been given 4 out of 5 rainbows by BroadwayWorld.com and nominated for their Best Burlesque Cabaret award. Depending on your contribution level you receive Members Only Boylesque merchandise, tickets and more!

    The Impact

    By contributing to the campaign we plan to use the money to:

    • Copyright our company.
    • Create company merchandise.
    • Finish our Promotional materials and Teaser Video
    • Perform in the 2020 Vienna Boylesque Festival

    Risks & Challenges

    As a new company the risk is always making it to the year mark, while simultaneously proving the need/want of your business. But here’s the facts on why we overcame that:

    • 100% of our shows in 2019 were more than 3/4 capacity or entirely sold out.
    • Our show was nominated for Best Burlesque Cabaret on BroadwayWorld.com
    • 9 performers who touched the stage at our show were nominated for NYC Glam Awards, in Best Burlesque, Best Comedy, Best Cabaret, and Best Gogo Dancer.
    • Monthly residency at the Laurie Beechman Theatre in Midtown Manhattan.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you are not able to contribute at this time, don’t fret. You can still help us reach our goal by sharing this campaign with your friends, families, enemies, ex-husbands, whoever you want to guilt into helping us.

story:
"You can’t go back and change the beginning, but you can start where you are and change the ending.”
— C. S. Lewis


This year’s production Wonderland is a twist on the classic Alice in Wonderland adventures. In this version, Alice falls down the rabbit hole with her cat, Dinah, who serves as her companion as she journeys through the upside-down world of Wonderland. The White Rabbit tells the story as it unfolds. With each new character and each new scenario, Alice faces a different challenge, ranging from personal growth to social justice issues. Watch Alice change into various different forms of herself.

story:
Help us get our Mexican to Finland!

¡ZARZAMORA!, Austin's premiere historical improv troupe, has been selected to play at the Finland International Improv Festival in Tampere, Finland. We are honored to be the first Austin troupe to play this wondrous, storied, frigid country. 

However, not all is Sahti and skittles. Like the Soviets, we're running into a few challenges in getting into Finland. The Nordic countries are not as inexpensive as one might assume from their furniture. That's where YOU come in!

We're trying to raise two thousand dollars to help our resident Mexican, Estevan "Chuy" Zarate, join us in our northerly travels.

Chuy is one of the most beloved and respected improvisers in town, in addition to being an accomplished actor and theatrical director. While the rest of us are laboring away at 9 to 5 jobs, Chuy has instead been giving of himself to the Austin arts community. And while we've been living the freewheeling single lifestyle, Chuy has been getting married and having kids. That leads to no disposable income for things like flitting off to Finland for wacky make-em-ups.

Perhaps you've been the beneficiary of Chuy's time, his talent, and his dedication. Perhaps you only hope to be. In either case, his contributions to the improv scene and the Austin arts scene in general cannot be overstated. 

If you love Chuy (and who doesn't?), please consider taking a moment to throw a few bucks his way. As the signs held by the old homeless guys on the side of the highway say, anything helps.

story:
"It mentions that we should be particularly careful going into the area just southeast of the pool house. An elderly guest from Nepal was wandering the grounds last summer and stepped on one...I like that kind of transparency." 

Joyful Path is not your average, run-of-the-mill self-realization meditation healing centre and bed & breakfast. Located in the mojave desert, it exists in a hotbed of paranormal and bizarre phenomena, from UFOs to ancient cults and urban guerrilla groups. And when five guests show up with their own baggage, the dark history of the location begins to surface, forcing the visitors to confront their warped and twisted reality. 

"Sienna's Mantram; or, A Change of Pace at China Lake" is a new play by Zach Stephens being debuted this winter in Horse Trade's NY Frigid Festival at the Kraine Theater. This funny and disturbing play takes aim at what happens when we allow our fear of the unknown to color our perceptions of reality. Combining modern elements with strange phenomena from the past (Patty Hearst, Area 51, nuclear fears in the 50s) this play hopes to resonate with audience members living in an era all-too-frequently referred to as "post-fact". 

Sienna's Mantram will feature actors Zach Stephens, Amanda Barlow, Stefanie Flamm, James Martin and Elizabeth Taylor and sound design by August Belfiglio. 

Performances will take place at the Kraine Theater (85 E 4th St, NY, NY) February 18th, 23rd & 25th and March 1st & 8th. 

Playwright Zach Stephens and director Kelly Webb last collaborated on "Tailspin!", a farcical play about the North Korea/Sony hacks that was performed in the 2016 NY International Fringe Festival as well as the Venus/Adonis Festival at the Hudson Guild Theater. Critics called "Tailspin!" "a zany, slapstick comedy that offers telling insight into our celebrity-obsessed, social-media-saturated culture.” (Adrienne Urbanski, Theatre is Easy)

 

We Need Your Help!

We know the movie "La La Land" made it look pretty easy, but putting on a piece of theater requires a lot of things that cost money! Here's a breakdown of where your money is going to go:

  • Festival fees: $1,000
  • Rehearsal space rentals: $900
  • Stipends for cast and crew: $450
  • Postcards and other promotional materials: $200
  • Set, props, insurance, costumes, other expenses: $550

Help us secure our funds so we don't have to close after opening night and move back in with our parents in Boulder City, Nevada. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this page with your friends/family/yoga teacher/cult leader! Follow us on Instagram or Twitter @SiennasMantram or like our facebook page:  https://www.facebook.com/siennasmantram/ for updates on the show, rehearsal photos and more fun stuff! 

Tickets are also currently available for all performances here

story:
Friends! Thank you so much for checking out the The New Grindstone Comedy Theatre Campaign.

ABOUT: Grindstone Theatre is a non-profit Edmonton based theatre company established in 2011 by Founder and Artistic Director Byron Martin. Grindstone currently operates shows, classes and administration out of the Basement Theatre in Holy Trinity Anglican Church in Old Strathcona. Grindstone is most well known for their improvised musical The 11 O’clock Number! but also produces main stage plays and musicals, produces Blackout Sketch Comedy, provides corporate entertainment, runs public classes, offers school workshops, school performances and free monthly events such as The Open Improv Jam and the Social Scene.

THE PLANS: In January, Grindstone Comedy Theatre will begin renovations on its new theatre on the third floor of the Hulbert Block (right above Block 1912 on Whyte Avenue). Our purpose for this space is to offer artists and producers an affordable, intimate space for high quality comedy shows and to give audiences an alternative to their night out on Whyte Avenue. This venue will be home to shows such as The 11 O'clock Number : The Improvised Musical, The Musical Mixer, Go 4 Broke Improv, The All Ladies Comedy Show, YEG Flix, Weird Al Kareoke, Who's Rhyme is it Anyway?!, All The Way Cabaret, Weekly Stand Up and much more! After three months of renovations we plan to open at the beginning of April 2017!

THE COST: The proposed renovations are a massive undertaking. We need to build an 80 seat theatre, a green room, a lobby/bar and rooftop patio. The projected costs look to be around $65 000. Working hard over the last year we have raised a significant amount of our expenses through fundraisers and donations but we still need to raise $20 000 to complete all of our renos. Yes, that’s a lot of money….but we believe in the impact this new theatre will have in our community, and we believe that through the support of our community, we will be able to reach our financial goals. 

PERKS: When you donate to our campaign, you get some goodies too! We've are offering passes to Grindstone Theatre shows, your name on a plaque in the lobby of our new theatre, or possibly even a private party for you and your friends! Check out the perks on the right side of our campaign page!! We can't wait to share these with you!!

YOU: Why do we need you? Because every single ounce of support for this project will take us miles. You can support us financially if you are able or you can help us by spreading the word of our campaign! Share this link on social media! Send the link in an email to all of your friends! Call us and tell us that ‘we can do it’! Come see any one of our shows! Ask questions! We cannot do this without you so if you have any other creative ways in which to help, let us know! 

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR SUPPORTING GRINDSTONE COMEDY THEATRE!!

story:
Our Story

My name is Casey Groves, and I am the Artistic Director of Inner Compass Theatre. My wife, Rachel Whitman Groves, and I are acting in a production of Hogan’s Goat by William Alfred in New Orleans this spring, and we are asking for your help in funding it. Inner Compass Theatre on Facebook.

I started acting in high school and went to New Orleans Center for Creative Arts. I was an adjunct theater professor and director of the Greek Theatre Project at St. Peter's College in NJ for 6 years, and I currently teach acting classes at the Healing Center in New Orleans. I produced and acted in a successful Off Broadway production and national tour of the one man play, Damien; and I've performed it 150 times. Casey's IMDB Page.

The Play

Hogan's Goat opens on Sunday, May 20th and we are very happy to be partnering with the IRISH HOUSE on St. Charles to put this production on. The play is a battleground between faith and ambition in an Irish Immigrant community during a mayor’s race in Brooklyn in 1890. There are strong parallels in this modern verse play to our own Irish Channel and to the coming backbiting of the 2012 elections. The site-specific, dark wood warmth and yesteryear decor of the IRISH HOUSE provides the perfect atmosphere for this play that takes place in pubs and townhouses. This is the inaugural production for the recently returned NOLA natives who are starting Inner Compass Theatre.

Rachel and I fell in love with this play after doing a scene from it with renowned acting coach, Larry Moss, in NYC last year. Hogan's Goat is a morality play in verse about love, scandal and blind ambition in an Irish Immigrant community during a mayoral election in Brooklyn in 1890. The poetry is powerful, the stakes are high, the lessons are mammoth, and you can't help but empathize with each of the multidimensional well drawn characters no matter whose side they're on. There are strong parallels to "The Scottish Play" and "Othello" set within a semi-modern Irish American context. Ugly truths are faced squarely and political machinations are seen up close and personal. Each of us has drives and impulses which take us away from our truest selves. Through exposing them one by one, we as an audience will hopefully gain greater awareness of these impulses in ourselves and avoid the pitfalls they present. The play addresses the subhuman conditions faced by the Irish as they crossed the Atlantic as well as the opportunities that some seized in this new Promised Land. The play has us embrace deep religious faith through some of the characters, and it has us challenge faith in pursuit of a more mature relationship with God through other characters. Ultimately, pride and ambition are the emperor's new clothes that are worn and paraded with pomp across the stage.

Our goal is to raise $8,000 for the production. %5 of all the money you give to this project will go to the Ancient Order of Hibernians to feed people in need through the Hibernian Hunger Project which honors and commemorates the Great Famine of Ireland. The Famine created a hunger in people getting off the boat with a need to fill it by "getting power" (as the play states). Your contributions will help to alleviate that kind of hunger enabling recipients to lead a more balanced and faith filled life.

What We Need & What You Get

2/3rds of our budget of $8,000 goes to pay personnel including the nine actors, the director, an Irish musician and composer, an Irish accent coach, a costumer and other creatives. The other 1/3 of the budget pays for theater and rehearsal space rental, performance rights, materials and administrative costs. A lot of great local artists are giving their time to bring this project to life. Your donation will go into the local economy and keep artists alive, vibrant, and working in New Orleans.

Here are some of the things you get when you give: Donations of $3000 or more will enable you to have a Private Performance of the play for you, your family, friends and your organization on any night during the run of the show that you choose. Other funding levels will give you an ad in the program and free tickets!

Thank you all for considering donating to this production of Hogan's Goat. And Spread the Word!

story:
The Box Show

The Box Show is coming to the New York Fringe Festival! Thank you everyone who helped bring it to NYC in the first place and build The Box. Now Dominique is preparing the next and greatest version for her run of shows in August.

See details of the show and schedule here: www.theboxshow.org

Watch the Trailer for the Box Show

 

(Hidden Fees) of the New York Fringe Festival

It turns out there's a lot of expenses producing this show for the Fringe, including:

  • Moving The Box across town
  • Promoting the show (Hopefully we can promote it enough to sell out and get on the "Fringe FAVEs" list)
  • Stage manager
  • Insurance fees
  • Festival fees
  • ...

Though she desperately needs funding, Dominique was reticent to do another campaign (original campaign was here), so I decided to do one for her! Hurrah! Just a little would help enormously to make the box show a success and let Dominique focus on making it the best show possible and not worry about running around raising money. 

-Jeshua

story:
UPDATE:

Hello! I'm so sorry I haven't updated you all in a while. I've been super busy with school and finals are coming up very soon! Grrr. In a week, school will be over for this year and summer vacation will finally be here. You all might be wondering what I am doing this summer... :) As of right now, I plan on putting all my time and energy into theatre/film/acting. I have a summer internship at The Theatre Lab at the Firehouse Theatre Project and some pretty amazing things will happen at FTP this summer (including Rocky Horror Picture Show....ahhh!). To add on, I'm heading up to NYC for an intensive. I also have some "mini projects" going on now and this summer. You can find out more about them at: www.natashaYliu.com .  

You all might be wondering how I had enough $$$ to pay for the intensive (because I'm saving up every cent for IAA). To be honest, I was thinking about not doing the intensive anymore and putting the money towards IAA tuition/expenses, but I paid for the intensive long before I even auditioned for IAA and the money deposited towards it was, of course, non-refundable. Well, on the bright side, I will be learning much and will get to see if I can survive NYC alone on a super tight budget. :) 

Again, thanks so much for all your support so far and have a great summer!

UPDATE:

Hi guys! Thanks so much for the support you all have given me. I really appreciate it. I'm sorry I haven't been able to update much lately...I've been super busy and stressed with school and extracurricular work. I'm currently at 13 funders...which is really unlucky!

Who will be the person to bring it up to 14? ;) 

-------

Summary

Hello there! My name is Natasha Liu and I am an actress, currently based in Richmond, VA. You can check out more of my recent or past projects, as well as my resume on: www.natashayliu.com .

Though I like my current school, I really feel as though I am not getting intense enough acting training in the theatre department as well as a diverse enough variety of academic courses. In short, I am extremely dedicated to my studies in the arts and academics and love learning. I would like to be able to grow much more as an actress and student. 

Interlochen Arts Academy gives young artists a chance to learn, be immersed in their focus area, and focuses on artistic and academic excellence. It offers many courses my school and area, do not offer. Students get to work and learn in a state of the art environment and are educated by some of the most knowledgeable teachers in the nation. Some masterclass instructors that Interlochen theatre students have been fortunate enough to learn from include Sutton Foster, Victoria Clarke, and Heather Headley. To add on, some notable alumni of Interlochen include Josh Groban, Norah Jones, Jewel, and Felicity Huffman.

That being said, the school is an amazing opportunity for me to grow as an actress as well as a student and would be a life changing experience.

Though I am EXTREMELY thankful for the help Interlochen ($34,000 in aid), my grandparents ($2,500), and my parents ($4,500), who are in financial hardship, have given me, that total amount, plus all my own savings and money I can make by work before September, is, unfortunately, still not enough for me to be able to go to Interlochen! 

The Impact

By contributing to this campaign, you will be opening many great opportunities in my career that would otherwise never have been there, will be making me a more competitive applicant when applying to colleges, and will significantly aid in my growth as a student and an artist.

Furthermore, I am going to go back to Richmond someday to continue working as an actress and hope to teach people what I've learned through this invigorating experience. 

You will also save my hardworking family from losing $2,500. A mandatory $2,500 deposit for Interlochen was required (otherwise, I wouldn't have my spot held there at all), and my grandparents decided to give me a shot at raising the money...without the $2,500 they helped me with, I wouldn't even be on Indiegogo right now!

Breakdown of Costs:

Remaining Tuition (cost after the help of my parents: $4,500, grandparents: $2,500, the financial aid Interlochen has given me: $34,000, minus the fees that IndieGogo takes away after the fundraiser ends, if successful): $8,000


Tuition pays for meals at Interlochen, rooming (dorm!), and all classes.

What will I be paying for? I will be paying for all of the "extra expenses" (travel, technology fee, resident deposit, books/supplies, etc), which totals to around $4000! I will be working hard this summer.

All the proceeds in this campaign go towards the remaining tuition and nothing else.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, please spread the word to other people! Post the link to this on facebook, Google+, blog/vlog about it, put it on other websites, talk about it on youtube....anything to make more people know about this campaign!

Questions?

If you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask them at projectinterlochen@gmail.com !

story:
Here's a New Year's resolution you can keep:

 

Help bring PRIVATE LIVES to GTC Burbank!

 

 

What if Carrie and Mr. Big traveled back in time to 1930s and ? Theyâ€™d be starring in NoÃ«l Cowardâ€™s PRIVATE LIVES!

Yes, PRIVATE LIVES is as fun and timely as ever. Much like Shakespeareâ€™s Taming of the Shrew, PRIVATE LIVES is a classic â€œ of the Sexesâ€ about the people we canâ€™t live withâ€¦or without.

A production of PRIVATE LIVES featuring â€œSex and the Cityâ€ star Kim Cattrall recently ended its Broadway run. Now, our theatrical company, Table for Two Productions, has the rights to produce PRIVATE LIVES at GTC Burbank, an intimate 98 seat theatre where NoÃ«l Cowardâ€™s witty wordplay and scintillating humor will be on full display.

This is the first time in 10 years that PRIVATE LIVES will be produced in the Los Angeles/Burbank area. Weâ€™re assembling a team of professional actors, designers and other creative talents to help bring Cowardâ€™s clever comedy from the page to the stage. Award-winning stage director Jules Aaron has signed on to direct. The cast will be announced in mid January.

And hereâ€™s where you come in...

Your generous contribution will go directly towards the production costs, including: theatre rental, royalties, director, set design, light design, sound design, costume design, stage management, marketing, publicity, and advertising.

We have set a goal of $10,000 for this campaign, but even that does not cover all of the expenses weâ€™ll incur by opening day. Ticket sales will help contribute to our bottom line once the play opens, but like most live theater productions, theyâ€™ll only cover about 50 percent of our total cost.

So, letâ€™s see how much we can raise above and beyond the $10,000 goal!

Donations of every amount are welcomed. No amount is too smallâ€”or too large!

So why PRIVATE LIVES?

â€œDevastatingly funny.â€ â€œAn iridescent bubble of a play.â€ â€œSomething to go silly over.â€ â€œAll but continuous laughter.â€

Those are just a few of the accolades heaped upon the original 1930 production of PRIVATE LIVES, which follows the saga of perpetually dueling lovers Amanda and Elyot, two divorcees who unwittingly book adjoining rooms while honeymooning with their new spouses. They soon realize the folly of their new marriages and impulsively flee together to , only to be caught days later by their jilted spouses.

This stylish, savvy and still-timely comedy is loaded with pointed barbs about modern romance that anyone can relate to.

Written in 1930, the original production of Private Lives starred NoÃ«l Coward, Gertrude Lawrence, Adrianne Allen and Laurence Olivier. The play has been revived many times on Broadway (including a memorable 1983 production that starred Elizabeth Taylor and Richard Burton), and has been produced in theaters throughout the world.

Now, with your help, PRIVATE LIVES will be coming to GTC Burbank.

Who is Table for Two Productions?

Table for Two Productions was founded by Stasha Surdyke and Christopher Trela to create and host theatrical & culinary fundraising events for arts organizations, as well as present professionally produced plays in venues throughout.

 

Christopher and Stasha co-write the Table for Two dining column in the Newport Beach Independent, and they are the co-editors of Coastal Food and Wine, a website devoted to covering epicurean experiences along the coast of So Cal.

Nominated for a 2011 Women in Business Award from the Orange County Business Journal, Stasha Surdyke is an Ovation nominated actress and vocalist who has appeared in numerous commercials, films, television shows and theatrical productions throughout , including a starring role in An Empty Plate in the CafÃ© du Grand Boeuf at The Laguna Playhouse.

 

A graduate of University of Washingtonâ€™s School of Drama, she was one of eighteen students accepted into the schoolâ€™s prestigious two-year Suzuki program and received her BA in Drama and a minor in Communications from UW. Stasha is a proud member of Actorâ€™s Equity and Screen Actors Guild.

In addition to her performing credits, Stasha oversees media relations and other creative services for the boutique PR agency, ArtsPR. Stasha designed the award-winning press kit for Laguna Playhouseâ€™s production of The : Can You Be More Pacific? which won the 2011 PROTOS Award of Excellence this year.

 

She is a member of the Southern California Restaurant Writers Association, Orange County Press Club, and the NoÃ«l Coward Society.

Twice nominated for Entrepreneur of the Year by the Orange County Business Journal, Christopher Trela is the owner and president of ArtsPR, a boutique PR agency that specializes in public relations services for arts organizations. Current clients include The Laguna Playhouse, Irvine Barclay Theatre, Long Beach Symphony Orchestra, Festival Ballet Theatre, Chance Theater, The Queenâ€™s Gallery/MUZEO, Costa Mesa Playhouse, Young Singers of OC, and Classical Mystery Tour (a Beatles tribute band that performs with orchestras around the world).

He is also the founder of New Voices Playwrights Workshop, and has written plays that have been produced at venues throughout , , and .

 

Christopher is President of the Orange County Press Club, serves as an Arts Commissioner for the City of , and is an Adjunct Professor of Public Relations at . Christopher is a member of the Public Relations Society of America.

Stasha and Christopher thank you for your support!

For more information on Table for Two Productions and PRIVATE LIVES, visit our website: www.Table4Two-PrivateLives.com.
